Too much trouble for me. I was hoping for a true rechargeable product which would be excellent--if only this one delivered.

I really liked using these. They seemed to have a really good effect, without irritating my very sensitive skin. I'm always worried when I try something new -- I get redness, irritation and in bad cases hives so trying anything is a risk. I had absolutely NO problems with these and they left my skin feeling soft and supple and well moisturized.

I got these to add to my travel bag so I don't have to keep taking my regular brushes in and out. These are good quality brushes, are soft and smooth and I didn't have any stray bristles anywhere. Overall very satisfactory. I'm happy I got them, they are getting used frequently and it certainly saves time to have 2 sets.
I travel a lot and find that using a mister for a lot of things makes it easier. The problem has always been that the bottles leak or don't mist. These work perfectly and don't leak!

I’m using this for my body oil and it’s working perfectly. I wasn’t sure it would go through the sprayer but it does and it makes it so much easier to use. It’s a bit messy getting it started (oil you know) but once I got it primed, it’s working fine and I can spray when I finish in the shower and reach my back without help.

I’ve been looking for a shower cap for a long time that is sturdy, the right size and doesn’t wear out after a few uses. This is promising although it’s bigger than I need/want - I’ll still use it until something better comes along. It is adjustable so it’s very usable just way oversized for my head and the amount of hair I have. It is lightweight and water proof and dries quickly so other than size, it’s great.

These work okay on natural nails but they don't seem to last as long as some of my older ones that are still in use years later. I generally only use them to touch up rough edges or file down broken nails but I couldn't swear to their durability. I can't imagine them working well on acrylics or gels but since I'm not using either right now I can only attest to the fact that they are working on my natural nails and seem to work okay I'm just not sure about their durability.

This is a great Aloe Gel. I keep in the fridge and use it regularly. It’s light enough weight that it doesn’t feel goopy and washes off clean. Very thick, nice and cold from the fridge and it’s great for too much sun or too much kitchen (burns, cuts, grease spatters, etc.). Easy to use - no nasty smell and works.

I had a bit of trouble in the beginning getting this set exactly right for me but once it was set up (and I marked the spots the suction cups go onto) it's been a wonder. No more sore neck while soaking. I was worried about it staying damp but it doesn't. I do remove it when I'm not relaxing but it fits very nicely in my linen closet so it's only a second away.

I've been watching as every personality is raving about rose quartz and jade and microneedling etc. I did some research (from reputable sources) and there is actually some science to the use of these products. The microneedle blade is small enough for use. It makes little tiny, non-noticeable holes in the surface of your skin (in effect damaging it) so it will produce more collagen. While I wouldn't use it more than once a week, and just until my skin starts to get red, it does appear that my skin is softer and smoother after the treatment. So I'm find on the micro-needler. (Just remember gently, gently). The quartz roller is supposed to reduce redness, smooth the surface of the skin and help with lymphatic drainage. I'm not sure it actually does all that but it does feel nice and has definitely helped with under eye puffiness so it appears to be working. I'm very pleasantly surprised by the effectiveness of these devices and will continue to use them.

The packaging is fine and makes them giftable but I'm not sure the quality of the pieces will actually hold up. I've been using them for several months and so far so good but if they do fall apart, I'm willing to invest in more expensive products. For a starter set, I would give this a try to be sure it works for you (and you are willing to do it).

I wasn't really sure about this and when I first opened it I became even more skeptical. It looked like a paper towel and I had to wet it? Fortunately I thought ahead and opened it before soaking it in water and it was relatively easy to handle. I didn't love wearing it for 30 minutes, I got annoyed by then with the masque but 20 minutes was about my limit and I did see results. I liked the masque overall and it seemed to improve the tone and texture of my skin. I knocked off a point because it was a bit cumbersome to use and waiting around for 30 minutes seemed too much for me. I've got very sensitive skin and this was not of problem for me to use (although I did patch test first). If you know what you are going into (the time and effort) I'd recommend this product. If you don't have the time or want to bother with soaking the masque first, try something else but this does work!

There are a number of this type of product on the market and this one does not compare favorably to any others that I’ve tried. They don’t hold well and I didn’t notice any improvement. I’ll keep shopping.

Once I got comfortable using this, the hand part felt weird at first, I've seen decent results. I do use a cellulite gel and this brush and I can really see an improvement. I used the same combination a couple years ago and was very happy with my results but I fell by the wayside - I'm back and I'll continue to use it forever. Between the gel and the brush, the action of using the brush is the most important and I noticed results after a couple of weeks.

Nice scrub with a pleasant scent. Easy to use, extremely gentle, and I was using on one side only so I can see a difference after about 3 or 4 uses.  Feels good, works well and no bad after effects, what more do you need?

It is a thin piece of wire inside a cloth. Once twisted the clip loses shape - does not give desired effect, AND difficult to bring back to the original shape.

Not worth the money.
Great

I am not new to nail stamping, but I only recently became aware of She Modern Sticky Stamping Polishes. With traditional stamping polish it is necessary to work very quickly in order to successfully transfer the image onto the nail, and beginners frequently struggle to get the timing down. Even experienced stampers have difficulties with extremely fine lines or highly detailed images; the stamping polish just dries too quickly inside the very shallow etching. After watching several She Modern videos on YouTube and ordering a small set of sticky stamping polishes, I was eager to test them out on a stamping plate I’ve been unsuccessfully trying to use for over a year. My very first effort was flawless! The She Modern performed perfectly. Beginners will definitely find these polishes far, far easier to work with as they learn the basics, and more advanced stampers can enhance their artwork by using pigment powders, foils, and glitter. In addition, She Modern offers a comprehensive selection of watercolor polishes for techniques such as lead lining, reverse stamping, etc. The only limit is your imagination and She Modern even helps with that by providing live demonstrations of their products and techniques on YouTube every Tuesday and Friday. Tina very thoroughly and patiently opens each session by answering any questions from attendees before creating a nail design with various products. It’s very helpful to see them in use and gives you ideas for your own nail art. It’s a great line of products for nail artists at ANY skill level and the product support is outstanding!
It is exactly as described and perfect for young boys. Bought this for my 5 yr old

I have baby fine hair. Thin hair makes it difficult to curl my hair because either they are too hot, to large, hair gets caught in clips, or other reasons. As a result, I don't curl my hair often. This might change that.

CHARGING
Charging this took 3 hours once I got it. It has a gauge on it which lets you know when the battery is full and status of it.

CONTROL PANEL
The control panel is covered in the instructions, but it is not quite what it is described. I found it very intuitive, however and no problem in using it. Just mess with the buttons and you will figure it out. The right button changes the section, the left button chooses the level.

SETTING
Every time I turn this off, I have to reset it to F instead of C and then I have to reset the different times too. It does not remember so far every time I have used it and I have tried multiple ways.

CURLING
This thing is AWESOME. The thing is you have to have SMALL pieces of hair and make sure no other hairs are caught with it. If you don't then it will curl your hair tight and jam it up. More on that later. I set my hair for baby fine at 300F and 8 seconds and once it heated up, the curls were perfect. I had to redo a few of them but for the most part they were nice.

JAM
When you are not careful to separate ALL hair from a section, sometimes the shorter hairs will catch in the roller in the opposite direction and it will cause a jam. It is scary. That is one reason why I set it only at 8 seconds. All you do is make sure you have a mirror and then hit the controls until you reverse the direction and run it for a moment and VOILA- hair is out.

Make sure to comb the hair and then redo it in smaller sections.

TIMER
One more thing, this will roll up your hair and then it will beep each second of the count down of your hair in the roller. It gives a long beep when done, you release the button and your hair comes out.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a great curling iron. I love that I can do this in the living room with a mirror and not have to stand in the bathroom. My hair looks natural and beautiful.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS I wish this would set itself to Farenheit and stay there. It is annoying to reset it every time. I know it is supposed to stay, but mine doesn't. Other than that, this would get five stars, but I am taking one off for that.

PHOTO
I posted a photo of my hair so you can see how curly it is. Keep in mind, I have very little hair and it is very very fine. This curling iron really make my hair look amazing.

HOW THIS COMES
This bar of soap comes wrapped in plastic with a label on each side.

TEXTURE
This bar of soap is very crumbly before unwrapped. The soap feels like it will crumble but when you put water on it, it turns into a very muddy bar of soap. You can feel the mud in it.

CLEANING
This does clean the skin well, but if you have normal to dry skin, it really does make it feel stripped and tight when done using it.

INGREDIENTS
There is nothing in this bar of soap to indicate its ingredients other than Dead Sea Mud.

COUNTRY OF ORIGIN
Israel

WHO MIGHT LIKE THIS
Anyone with very dirty greasy skin or who has problems with oil and blemishes might be able to use this.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This bar of soap does not list ingredients but you can definitely feel there is a lot of mud in it. It cleans well but strips the skin.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. No ingredient list took a star off for me. The performance is good for some skin, but mine is more on the normal to dry side so I don't use it as much as the guys do.

I have been looking for some shampoos to help with cleaning hair, but also making the scalp heal for nice hair growth and also flaking.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes wrapped tight in plastic with the pump down.

HOW TO USE
Once the plastic is open, you turn the pump to make it pop up and then you can dispense the shampoo.

SIZE
The bottle is only 6 inches from the base to the top of the pump. It is pretty small.

SCENT
My mom found a really old bottle of shampoo in her attic that was by Fabrege called Farrah Fawcett shampoo. This scent reminds me of that. It is a really nice smelling shampoo.

SCALP
I did feel some tingling in my scalp when using this. It did not burn or hurt at all, it felt nice.

HAIR CLEAN?
I have very fine hair which is easily weighed down. It is hard to find a shampoo that encourages volume, does not make my hair look flat, and that does not make it full of static. This shampoo leaves my hair clean for a few days and it somewhat encourages waves. I can not comment on static, as it is not near winter yet. My hair was not left dry or frizzy at all.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a nice shampoo. It is a small bottle, but a little bit goes a long way. It makes my scalp feel better and leaves my hair nice and clean.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I wish the bottle was not so small, but I do like the shampoo. I was going to give this to my daughter (she has scalp issues) but I think I will buy her a 2nd one and keep this one for me.

I have tried many high end skin products over time and I also make my own skin care which I use a lot as well. Once in a while I like to check out another line to trade off for a while. This line, Wow. I am impressed so far.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a box. The bottle inside is glass with a lock pump top. Turn to the side and you can pump and then turn it back and it locks.

TEXTURE OF THE LOTION
This is what I would think of as a lotion texture. Thick, but not too thick.

MY SKIN TYPE
I tend to have normal to dry skin and it has some uneven patches on it which most probably don't notice, but I do.

HOW I USE THIS
I start with the XXI cleanser which is great stuff. Then I apply a Hyaluronic Acid serum on my skin. After that, I use this Vitamin C lotion and I finish with the XXI firming lotion on top of that. I only do this 1 time at night.

RESULTS
The results of this product line have been really impressive. My face has looked younger, more glowy, and my skin looks more awake and less tired. I have been through a lot of deaths this year and my face has looked very tired. I could not believe how much this and the other two XXI products affected how I look. It was quite exciting for me right now.

THE BOTTOM LINE
My skin glows after using this. It is soft, moisturized and when combined with the other XXI cleanser and firming lotion, the results are impressive.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I will continue to buy products from this line (well the ones I mentioned, anyway). I really have been thankful to have them right now. They have given me a boost when I really needed one.

I have baby fine hair. That means that although I can make it look like I have quite a bit of hair, in reality, my pony tail is the size of a watercolor brush. I need hair ties that can pull my hair back, stay put, and not destroy what hair I do have.

HOW THESE COME
These come in a plastic bag.

COLOR
The colors are all brilliant neon which I LOVE, except the blue- I would call it neon navy if that were a thing.

PERFORMANCE
These work perfectly for me. I use them alone on hot days and even have them stay put during exercise and activity. They do not tear out my hair when I remove them either.

THE BOTTOM LINE
These hair bands are perfect for me. I have baby fine hair and not as much of it as it looks, so having these is perfect. They also work well for kids.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I am thrilled to have these. Most other hair bands slide out easily and frustrate me. These stay put most of the time.

As a makeup artist, I am always trying to find ways to get the most mileage out of the products that I use. This bronzer had some surprises to it. Read on..

PHOTO- My photo has swatches of both color 1 and 2 which are labeled. I tried to get accurate photos colorwise and it is hard to do as the camera does not capture the nuances. When applied with a brush, the effect is MUCH lighter.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
COMPACT
The compact is a high layered cardboard with a strong hinge to it. There is no mirror and the pan inside has the product with designs pressed into it. It does not come with a brush.

WHAT IS THE COLOR LIKE?
This color is more of a bronze gold color. It is still on the cooler side, but light warmer skin tones could use this too.

TYPE OF SKIN TESTED ON?
This was tested on both MAC translation of skin tones NW 25 (which is what you see in the photos) and NC37 which is a more tan but cooler skin tone.

HOW TO APPLY?
This applies well but you have to be sure you find the right brush. A stippling brush was the best way to get a natural look from this bronzer and highlighter. It allows for subtle application so that it does not look like you have on too much. If you use too dense of a brush, it is easy to get a stripe of glow on your face that others will see and it can really look odd. You also need to get a fresh brush and blend it very well into your skin. Apply this in the backwards 3 figure on each side of your face. Imagine two 3s in a mirror image on your face with the tips and centers touching.

ANY OTHER USES?
I found that this also makes a fabulous eye shadow. I found it to be a perfect match with the other color in this series of number 2 which is a darker more rose brown color. This is a great companion to that. If this is all you have, It also makes a great eye shadow alone or with another lighter satin finish shadow or even a matte. I would not go super frosty.

HOW TO APPLY TO EYES
In terms of eyes, you can use this as a contour, all over color, or in combination with the other darker color of this Sungasm series or another set of shadows. The application is best for a lighter look to use a teardrop shaped brush. Then for a heavier look with more color, a flat eye shadow brush packing this gently into place over a good eye primer is the way to go. For a quick application, you can also use a finger to apply and blend it with a brush or your finger

ANY IRRITATION PROBLEMS?
I am VERY sensitive and did not have any problems with this product on the face or eyes.

THE BOTTOM LINE
As long as you are willing to take some time to find the right brush for the application of this, this bronzer is a pretty color especially for cooler toned skin. It is a good highlighter for darker skin tones as a highlighter, though. This is beautiful on the face, eyes, and in tandem with the other color of this bronzer too.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is a nice bronzer and I am surprised at how well it works on cooler skin tones, something that is not all that easy to find, especially in TWO colors of a collections.

I am a makeup artist. I am always finding ways to make cosmetics work for all sorts of uses to get the best look and bang for the buck. This Luminating Bronzer has some surprises up its sleeve.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
COMPACT
This comes in a heavy cardboard compact with a strong cardboard hinge on it. There is no mirror. The pan inside has printed letters and design on it. In this case, the color is number 2, the darker of the two in this collection.

WHAT COLOR IS THIS?
This bronzer is a unique color. Instead of being the usual brown or orange color so many bronzers are, this one is a rose toned base which at first seems unusual. If used on cooler toned skin, you will still see a luminzer effect but the undertone is more of a rose tan.

WHAT COLOR SKIN DID I USE THIS ON?
Right now, I tried this on two colors of skin. One was translated into MAC foundation color as NC27- a tanned color which leans toward the cooler side, and NW25 which is a cooler lighter caucasian leaning color.

EFFECTS?
Things like this have a need for you to choose the right brush. The wrong brush can make it look horrible. The right brush can make it look like a million bucks. When used with a STIPPLING brush (look that up to find out what that means), this bronzer provides the perfect luminescence and glow along with color.

You can see the cheekbones highlighted and see the spot of color, but it is subtle, and not overbearing.

If you use the dense fluffy brush like you might use to apply blush, the results border on ridiculous. It is like you have smears of bright shimmer on and it is hard to blend in well.

WHAT OTHER USES?
Interestingly, I have both color 1 and 2 of this line of Sungasm bronzers. When using this particular color 2 on the creases of the eyes, it provides a GORGEOUS natural look similar to the old J Lo type look or other natural based looks which in reality take a lot of makeup but they just don't look like it.

This put together with color 1 in this series, the two together make a great duo on the eyes. It really is amazing. It brings out the color of the eyes perfectly. In fact, I use the lighter one on the upper cheekbones for highlight/bronzer and the darker number 2 under it and blend well. The effect is subtle but beautiful.

HOW TO APPLY TO EYES
I have used good shadow brushes and my finger as well. The idea is for medium to subtle color, use a tear drop shaped shadow brush. For more intensity use a flat eye shadow brush on top of eye primer and blend once you have applied the other colors. For a quick application, I have successfully used my fingers.

DOES IT BURN ON THE EYES?
I have a terrible time with products on my eyes. They usually burn and give me trouble. This bronzer did not do that. If you are concerned, be sure to get a good eye primer that you are comfortable with and use that first on your eyes.

WHAT ABOUT DARKER SKIN TONES?
If you use this on darker skin tones, there is a good chance it could show up a bit on the ghostly side. It has to be applied very lightly and blended well a little at a time to test the best depth if you want to try it.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Not only as a gorgeous rose based bronzer highlighter, but also as a contour or all over eye shadow, this color bronzer is a great price with good performance. It is not the usual color for bronzers but it works on medium to lighter skin tones.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is a great multi purpose product for summer. It doubles as bronzer and luminzer but also as a great eye shadow.

I have been working with wigs for quite a few years now. One thing I know is a good quality vs not so great quality wig. Let's take a look at this one.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?

HAIR
This wig has some great hair. the colors are definitely platinum white and what I would call light auburn base hairs. The white hairs are about 1/3 or so longer than the auburn hairs. There is a nice kink to the hairs.

THICKNESS
That is where this wig is sadly lacking. At the top, the wefts of hair are way too far apart. The lace in the cap is a very light butter colored yellow. The hair is not too thin, but it is not quite thick enough to cover hair below. Yes, this comes with a nylon cap, but it just is not comfortable with those. If you have dark hair it will definitely show the bright colored lace and elastics through the wig when the wind blows.

BANGS/STYLE
That is where this wig is just not practical unless you don't mind looking stupid for a party or Halloween. The bangs are WAY too long for anyone to wear. That usually would not be a problem, but what you will get instead of the cool light ends on the entire head is chopped bang that is bland looking and then these white cool looking ends around the head. The bangs are best cut painstakingly so that the auburn is cut way shorter (about 2/3) than the white hairs. That takes a lot of time but worth the effort. Then you have to cut them at a staggered manner.

Other than the bangs being hard to trim so you can at least function with this wig on, the overall style is fabulous. I love how it falls and looks while on the head.

ELASTIC BANDS
Inside the wig, there are elastic bands with hooks to help hold the wig on the head. You might want to take them down to the spot you like it in as the hooks have a tendency to come undone during wearing.

WHAT I WANT IN A WIG
Believe it or not, I would actually wear a wig like this with the right outfit, and not to be silly either. I prefer wigs that look authentic,, and can be worn realistically as well as for fun.

1. I have to be able to see out of it
2. I have to be able to wear it comfortably without fussing
3. I want it to not have my real hair showing
4. I want it to look realistic
5. I want it to last for quite a few wearings

DOES THIS WIG PASS THE TEST?
I am giving this wig THREE stars because it is hard to wear and see. In order to trim this in a realistic manner, I have to take a LOT of time and that takes stars off for me. I happen to love the style and coloring, so I am wiling to put the work into it, but honestly, I think it should be a bit shorter in the bangs area since it is so hard to trim and keep it looking real. Also, the wefting on the top is just a bit too widely spaced. I wish also that the cap was made with light auburn lace and elastic instead of the icy yellow colors.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you want to wear this for fun, it will be hard to see and hard to trim and not look silly in this. It is comfortable and the style is epic, but there will be work required. You can bandana it to help, but it still will look a bit floppy unless trimmed a little bit in the bangs/fringe area. I like this, but it takes work to wear and not look silly for me.

MY RATING
THREE STARS. The trimming of the bangs is VERY time consuming since we only have one shot at it and if it is screwed up, then the wig is toast. I wish there was more hair on top and that the lace cap did not show as easily. A darker cap underneath (light auburn color) would have been much nicer with this. I will still use this, but it could have been a bit nicer with small inexpensive changes.

I have a set of Kolinsky sable brushes which moths got at a while ago and I have been wanting to replace them. This was a perfect shape for me, so I got it. Let's see what happened.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This has a wood handle for nails or even watercolor painting- it is a nice solid wood handle. The brush itself is a teardrop shape with a very fine point. The ferrule is average, nothing WOW, but not awful either.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
This brush has a nice pocket in it which absorbs the watercolor when using it. It will gradually disperse the paint in a nice thin line, but it does make it so I don't have to dip it as constantly as with a narrow brush. As for smoothness of lines and how it paints, I really like it. It is great for small areas of paintings.

CLEANING
I clean this regularly in the same product that I use for cleaning wool when it is time to store it. It has deterrent to moths in it. Other than that, I just clean with water most of the time and only use the other stuff when i am going to put it away for any length of time.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Although this can be used for nails, I prefer it for watercolor. I like nail brushes out of synthetic brushes instead of real sable.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This works for what I want it for in doing watercolors. It is not quite as nice as the Kolinsky Sable brushes I lost, but it is a nice fill in for now. I would buy it again.

I am all about natural skin care. When I read about this product and the lovely smell it had, I was very excited to try it. Let's take a look.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This cream is yellow in color- very pale yellow. It is creamy but not heavy. There is a very faint lemon smell, but there is also a smell which is not good- almost like the oils in the cream are about to turn completely rancid. They are not quite there yet, but I have used enough products over time where I recognize that smell.

That is not necessarily the fault of the cream. This could have been kept in a hot warehouse too long, or who knows what. The manufacture date on my box is April 2019. That is over a year old already.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
Since it is not unbearable at this point, I wanted to at least test the product for a few days. There was no burning or stinging, so it is still okay to use for now. The product is quite nice. It does soak in quickly and it does not leave the face greasy at all.

WHAT IS THE EFFECT ON SKIN?
The next morning after using this, I will say that the skin is left looking like it has a slight glow to it. It does leave the skin looking much nicer than other creams I have used. It is warmer weather right now and this cream is still not leaving the face greasy or heavy at all. My skin is definitely left looking nice the next morning.

ANY SENSITIVITY?
I have not had any sensitivity to the sun or anything else yet. Like I said, I can not use this long as it is ready to turn bad soon so I only have a short time. For now, it is really nice.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I really wish that this cream was fresher than it is. The product manufacture date on it is April of 2019. I am really disappointed that I could not test it at its best because it has great potential to be a really nice cream.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS- I can not give this five stars in its current state. It is potentially really nice cream though. If you get a fresh one, I imagine it is really nice. Just make sure to use it up and if you live in a hot climate, keep it in the refrigerator or air conditioning.

I am always on the lookout for really nice simple skin care. Let's take a look at this ampule.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This is a clear solution that comes out with an eye dropper.

HOW TO USE
The idea is that you use a toner on your CLEAN face, apply this to the face and neck and chest, and then follow up with a moisturizer.

WHAT DOES IT PROMISE TO DO?
This promises to lighted dark spots, and add firmness, glow, and hydration.

DOES IT DO WHAT IT SAYS?
I used this with another Korean toner which is pretty simple, and also the BE PLAIN Aqua moisturizer. When used, this did not seem to moisturize that much on its own, and for brightness and glow, I would say not over WOW factor after using for a month.

DID SKIN LOOK FIRMER?
I guess you could say my skin looked a bit firmer, but nothing so dramatic that people said, "WOW, WHAT ARE YOU USING ON YOUR FACE?"

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a scent free, easy to use serum for the face. It works well with moisturizer, is simple, scent free, and gives a moderate amount of what it says it will do. It is not remarkable, but it is not terrible either.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. This is decent, but not my favorite product at this point.

I was spoiled. I had a wonderful big compact mirror from OTT LITE some time ago. I used it a lot. However, it broke and I could not replace it. I was hoping Let's take a look.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This mirror closes and snaps shut with a plastic clip on it. It says open, but honestly, it is not easy to do. Once open, the inside has the 10X magnifier on one side and the reguiar mirror surrounded by the light ring.

ON/OFF
This has one light brightness- on. There is a little switch on the back that you push from one side to the other to turn it on and off. It does not shut the light off when you close it.

CASE
The case is quite slick. If it is cold out and my hands are cold, it is sometimes a bit tough to hold on to this. Most of the time it is not a problem.

BRIGHTNESS
This is a bit too bright for me. It really does seem to be so bright that I can not look into the regular mirror long, but the magnifier is okay IF I REALLY WANT TO SEE MY PORES. Sorry, but it is a bit overwhelming.

BATTERIES
This takes 2 CR2032 batteries.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I am not really that impressed with this mirror. It works, but it is a bit frustrating to open, and bright to look into.

MY RATING
THREE STARS. This works, but it is not the best light in my opinion. That little switch on the back could easily be damaged in my purse.

When it comes to nail polish remover, I have two choices. I use either the store brand, or professional brand, which is often pure acetone used in tough removal like gel polish. Let's look at this one.

WHAT TYPE OF POLISH?
I had on a very dark red polish which was wearing very intensely for a week. Removal with some removers would leave red stains everywhere.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This polish remover comes in the same type of bottle most store brands do. There is no special scent and it is typical remover.

HOW DID THIS PERFORM?
This polish remover took off the red polish with no problem, left no red staining, and did not leave my nails completely parched like some harsher ones might.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This polish removes regular nail polish (not talking about gel here) very well. It does not leave nails too stripped.

MY RATING
Five stars. It does what it is supposed to to without excessive problems or smells.

When it comes to styling devices, my family all has different preferences because we all have different hair. This looked like a really great product. Let's take a look..

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This comes in a nice box, well packed in a fancy presentation and comes with a little manual. The device has four buttons on it which are power, temp up or temp down or timer. The bent curling iron is supposed to be more handy to use.

MANUAL
The manual is bare bones. It looks fancy but never tells what temperature or time would be good to start with for different types of hair. That was very disappointing. It does tell how to basically press the buttons and what they are for, however.

HOW DID THIS PERFORM?
We tried this several times on various occasions. Each time, we set the temperature higher and higher until we were at the top temp but very few of the curls we tried making worked. The hair simply had a light bend in it. When using a different curling iron with each person, the hair looked great. Finally after trying for the last time today, we have determined that this curling iron just does not work. I am not sure if we got a bad one or what, but it just does not do hardly anything except leaving a partial bend in the hair no matter how we wind it.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Although a great concept, this curling iron did not seem to curl hair properly no matter what hair we used it on or how high or low the temperature was set.

MY RATING
TWO STARS. Great idea, just didn't work at all for us.

I don't know about you, but our household goes through nail clippers fast. Most of the time they don't cut right, or they just don't last. Toenail clippers- well it is even harder to find a decent pair. Let's see how this set measured up for us..

WHAT IS THIS NAIL CLIPPER SET LIKE?
This set comes with a hefty set of nail clippers. It says it is for fingernails and toenails. More on that in a minute. The clipper comes with a catch all for the clippings. It also comes with a faux leather snap shut case that also houses a nail file.

HOW DO THESE CLIPPER PERFORM?
These clippers are surprinsingly nice. I tried them on both finger and toe nails and they worked very well. I did not get any ragged edges, or dull bent nails or anything else that I usually have problems with regarding most clippers. I did even have good results on the thickest nail which is on the largest toe.

WHO MIGHT NOT BENEFIT BY THESE CLIPPERS?'
The only person I would think would not benefit from these are those who deal with very thick elderly nails. Those need special clippers.

THE NAIL FILE
The nail file is nice, very fine grade of file, this files nails decently. The tip is not overly great at cleaning under the nail but it works okay.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This nail clipper seems to work well on finger and toe nails not having any trouble with ragged edges or dull bending of nails. The enclosed case is great in that it keeps the file and clippers together.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I like the whole set although the nail file could be a bit better.

We have been through several Clarisonic brushes in our house (Mine kept dying) and my daughter swears by her Clarisonic Mia. She has to go to a camp which has a lot of other teens at it for a week to work for a city reach out program. She wanted to bring her Clarisonic, but I talked her into trying this one out. It is easy to transport and use and if it is lost or taken, it is not as expensive to replace.

WHAT IS THIS BRUSH LIKE?
First of all, this comes in a nice hard case which is great for travel. It comes with one soft brush for daily use and a harder brush for once a week or so use. There is a silicone brush head which is for dry sensitive skin types. The brush runs on batteries which did not come with our unit. They are AA batteries. There are two speeds- slower for daily use and higher for the harder brush to exfoliate.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
There are two speeds. The first speed is very slow and my daughter is not fond of it. She prefers to use it on the second speed which is faster. Since it runs on batteries, it is not going to have the consistency as a plug in version. My daughter prefers the exfoliating brush and uses it 2 times a week. She feels that it cleans her skin as good or better than her Clarisonic Mia as it gets rid of the dead skin cells leaving her skin softer and more clear too.

It seems to be very waterproof. My daughter uses this in the shower and has had no problems with it. After almost a month of use, twice a week, she is not having problems with the batteries running down yet. She does a lot of house sitting so having this handy has been great.

AFTER EXFOLIATING BRUSH
After using the exfoliating brush, my daughter wanted me to mention that it is important to put on good moisturizer as the skin has been exfoliated well and you will need to make sure to use moisturizer on the face to protect the skin as it repairs.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you want the cleaning of a Clarisonic Mia but want something more travel friendly that cleans well, this might be a brush for you to try out. Working best on the second speed with the exfoliating brush, twice a week does the trick for our daughter. She really likes it and thinks it works as good or at times better than her Clarisonic Mia which she still has.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS for this one although it is not fair to grade it against the Clarisonic which is electrically powered, it works as well but does have the battery power. I debated giving it four stars, but it does work better than any battery powered brush we have tested so far, so I am leaving it at five. The soft brush is not too great, though, so perhaps see this as FOUR AND A HALF.

I am a total mascara girl won’t leave the house without it. This by far is the best collection. The weight of it is spectacular it doesn’t feel like you’re way down. The white tube gives you that volume and that length let it dry and then apply either one of the mascaras and you will see your eyelashes look like you’re wearing falsies. Love love love Tarte!!!!!!

Not a fan of this polygel. It was hard to work with. I had to warm it in a cup of very hot water first to even be a little pliable. Look great but nothing natural about it. She’d like crazy. I was hoping to love this wig but I really dislike it.

This wig cost $18 and it feels super luxurious! The hair fibers are super soft and easy to manage! I love the ombré coloring, it is so nicely done! The wig looks super realistic, I wish my hair was actually like this!

I have purchased these swabs twice now and they never disappoint! They are tightly wound so no cotton falling off in my ears. I use them for hygiene purposes but I think the wooden stems make them great for paint/glue crafting projects!

I ordered a set of MUSE & Co Dazzling Collection 36 Stick-On Gel Nails Medium Length, French Sparkle for review.  Having preteen and a teenager in the house who love all things beauty, I felt they may like these.  The set has both plain and bedazzled nails.  The being was just to big and stuck up too far, often catching on clothes.  The had pretty good adhesion for a day or two then began coming up.  Overall nothing special, but the did work temporarily.

I ordered a set of 'Qiray 36 Pieces, 18 Colors Large Retractable Cotton Hair Ties Hair Bands, Suitable for All Hair Thickening Hairstyle' for review.  Both my daughters and wife have longer hair and go through a multitude of hair ties.  These are reasonably priced and are well made for hair ties.  My daughter told me these are her favorite hair ties.  They do not get caught up in her curls, nor do they get tangled when they are removed.  They have good stretch and hold her thick hair well.  These are nice and wide.  Overall, these are a good economical option for hair ties.

I ordered the 'Padgene Makeup Vanity Mirror with Lights,1x 2X 3X 5X 7X Magnification 360°Adjustable Rotation 4-Fold 34 LED Lighted Mirror with Touch Screen,Stand Height & Brightness Adjustable (White)' for review. This mirror comes fully assembled and is quite simple to use. It has a touch button to turn on the light. It has multiple magnifications. The ability to fold it up so it takes less space is also beneficial making it easier to store or take up less space on your counter top. The mirrors are clear without scratches or flaws. The stand is plastic, so it may not be as durable as a mirror with a metal base or stand. The price point does seem a little high for the quality, but my wife really likes this mirror and uses it everyday. Overall, this is a well made mirror with great magnification.

I hope this review is helpful!

I ordered 'Native Deodorant - Natural Deodorant - 3 Pack Seasonal' for review. this set comes with three different scents Each scent is light and not overpowering. The deodorant is soft and goes on smoothly. My wife, who has to use an extra strength deodorant has been pleased with the odor control. Her sensitive skin has no issues with this deodorant. Overall a great natural product.

I hope this review was helpful!

I ordered a ‘Boar Bristle Hair Brush with Nylon Pins for Thick Curly Long Wet Hair - Anti Static Brush Oval - Wooden Paddle’ for review.  My wife has curly hair that can be difficult to tame.  When this brush arrived, my younger daughter who has very long curly hair wanted to try it out.  When she brushed through her hair, she felt it reduced the static and made her hair feel softer.  So much so that my wife never got the chance to use as my daughter claimed it as hers.  The brush handle is made with a thick, durable feeling wood.  The bristles are much more durable and pull through the hair better than those with plastic or silicone bristles.  Overall, this is a nicely made brush, that works well, and worth its price point.

I ordered the 'Beast Blue Beard Oil with Organic Argan & Jojoba Oils, 1 fl oz' for review.
I love to try different beard oils. This one is a medium weight oil that initially smells very lightly scented. It's a very "cologne" type scent which I really don't care for. I am more into the woodsy, tea tree, sandalwood type scents. At first smell, this beard oil had a very light scent however once applied, this scent lasts a very long time. This is where I had a hard time with it. I like to put my beard oil on in the morning and night after brushing my teeth and I was still able to smell this beard oil into the next morning, which might have been a good thing had I enjoyed the scent. The beard oil itself as I said earlier, is a medium weight, and has a decent hold and is actually a nice overall beard oil but I ended up giving it to my son, as I personally didn't like the scent at all.

I ordered this Veta – Lash and Eyebrow Serum – 2-in-1 Lash & Brow Pen for review. My teenage daughter was willing to try it out for me and these are her thoughts. "The pen application is not difficult. However, if you accidentally get it in your eyes it stings really badly. I had used it a couple of times before that happened. But, now I don't want to use it again."
Unfortunately she did not use it long enough to see if there was any lash growth. If my wife is brave enough to try it I will update my review.

I ordered the 'Portable Travel Bottles Set, 3oz Leakproof Foldable Squeezable Silicone Travel Size Toiletries Containers, TSA Carry On for Shampoo Lotion Soap (Pack of 2)' for review. My daughter has her favorite hair products that she has to pack when we travel and it's never fun packing those large bottles and other travel containers are just to small and or hard to fill. This set is so nice with the wide mouth openings which make them easy to fill and as you use the product, up they collapse to take up less space plus make it much easier to get every last drop of that precious product out haha. We have tried other compact TSA approved toiletry containers and I will say that these are so much more functional than the others, and most definitely of greater value.

I like that this is aluminum free, made in Germany, etc. The scent isn't ideal for me. I'm sensitive to fragrance and this is very strong. Smells like baby powder. I prefer the men's scents which are usually more toned down but I couldn't find a Nivea men's without aluminum.

Other than my husband saying this looks like a torture kit from the movies, this little set has a lot of options for the price.  My husband had no idea how to use most of the tools it comes with, and frankly, there are a few that have even stumped me. But, I love the masculine black look of the tools and so did he. The packaging looks very nice and professional and the leather is soft and bends easily—this made it easy to tuck it into a larger bathroom bag. All of the clippers seem to work well without issue. I did take one star off because the little pair of scissors are really thin and flimsy. The first time my husband took them out to cut his large toenail, it bent them. But, other than that, the rest seem well made and sturdy and he said he will continue to use them... and secretly, I want him to have his own pair so he quits taking mine out of my makeup bag and losing them. :)

For me, I had tried many times to deal with a couple of spots on my skin. Nothing I tried worked, so I then I was this and thought I'd try it. After a couple of weeks of putting it on those spots, they are almost gone. I would recommend that you try it if, like me, you tried everything without success.
Good thought mask were included ?

This is a nice sized palm brush - slightly smaller than some I've seen, and easy to handle. The boar bristles are a nice moderate stiffness and seem to do a good job, even with my thinning hair. Boar bristles are known.to provide benefits to the scalp as well as redistributing natural oils through your hair.

The scent you can feel? I wasn't certain what that could mean, but now that I've used it, I get it. I dont know if it's the caffeine or the tea tree oil... or maybe its eucalyptus, but it does have a tingling effect on your skin. And that tingling effect is not just some slight effect, its noticable. In fact, certain times (and xertain areas of skin), it's almost too much. As such, I dont use this daily.

As for scent - it is a strong but pleasant scent that smells like it feels... and again, it strikes me as a bit strong. I have some Beast "Blue" beard oil that has the same scent. It cleans nicely and the scent stays with you as you go about your day.

This beard oil from "The Beast" seems like it's pretty good for the health of your beard. It's only got a cou po le of ingredients, argon oil and jojoba oil... similar to some other beard oil I've tried. And it does seem to keep your beard soft and shiny. It also lists a scent among its ingredients. The scent is certainly "manly", but to me, it's more of an oil like scent... It's not unpleasant and it's not overpowering... but there.

Lots of tools in a compact set. I was afraid this set might be huge, taking up too much precious space in a suitcase for travelling. But not...  in fact, they've done a nice job of effort iently using space in this leather, folding case. The tools themselves are decent... not great, but they'll get the job done and the fact that they've got just about any need covered makes this an ideal item to toss into a suitcase for a trip. Nicely packaged, it would also make a nice gift.
I scratched my eyebrows trying to get the pencil color onto my brow.
Not great for a wider face. The stencil is not wide enough.
Great disposable shower cap for coloring  your hair or using purple hair masks at home. I should have bought these years ago.

I used this scrub right before shaving my legs and it made the floor of the shower extremely slippery. I didn't mind that, but the scrub leaves behind a super thick layer of candle wax looking stuff that was impossible to get off my legs. I had to scrub with a washcloth and soap to even make a dent. While shaving, huge globs of the candle wax looking stuff were on the razor. I love bath and body works, but they really missed the mark on this one

Ingredients:
Miracle Oil® Ingredients:

Olive Oil, Canola Oil, Wheat Germ Oil, Sweet Almond Oil, Sesame Seed Oil, Castor Oil, Safflower Oil, Dimethicone, Vitamins E, A & D, Burdock Root, Chamomile, Hyssop, Henna, Alfalfa, Sage, Goldenseal, Jaborandi, Slippery Elm Bark, Sheep Sorrell, Wheat Germ, Cherry Bark, Comfrey, Black Walnut, Yarrow, Fragrance

This product contains no animal fat or oils and is a cruelty free product.

***
I have used this for 20 years. I can not smell any fragrance with this at all,
this is best used in light applications for body and hair- a little goes along way! Its NOT gloppy like olive oil/almond/canola, seems lighter than grape seed oil even.
Worth the $. I lightly apply it through my hair the day I need to wash it- lightly oil all hair, twist up/clip, time it like a light hot oil treatment so it can soak in and work. It is a God send for unruley eyebrows. It washes right out no residue. I do this 2 times a week. I live in the desert/New Mexico/hard water/50 yrs/unprocessed thick semi curly hair. My hair shines but its not oily looking after washing, it semi tames and makes it so much better...it looks alive and healthy. My beautican is astounded. I have found its so much cheaper and works far much better than high scale salon items. It feeds your hair and body.
How I apply this I squeaze a small amount (pea size) onto one palm then rub my hands/palms quickly together till oil is warm- then lay my hands on area and massage in-it sinks right into dry scaley elbows, chapped lips, wind burned knees- etc. it does leave a light very fine oil film if it doesnt soak in 100%. If that happens it doesnt stain my clothes.
Oddly I have found for some reason it heals skin/cuts/wind burn more quickly than salves.
I keep my oil bottle on the (metal) end of an old frozen OJ tube style container- making a tiny saucer in case a drop oil seeps out.
Just my 2 cents....

This is a lip stain, not lipstick. And yes, they're cotton swabs. You break one end so it flows to the other, and there's a LOT of stain in each cotton swab (there's 20 in the box, each wrapped in plastic). I think you can get two uses out of each one, but obviously, they're meant for single use.

This stain works VERY well. The I am Fine color is reddish-brown, but it was a very nice red color on my lips. And my fingers - be careful when you apply these since they do stain. It's best to exfoliate before you use them, and to line your lips since I noticed a bit of bleeding/feathering when I used the product. Nothing that was obvious unless one was very close, but it would be prevented from lining my lips which I don't normally think to do when using a stain. Then again, the applicator is a cotton swab (so no fine control) and you get a LOT of product with it.

It does last all day unless you eat something greasy/buttery. So this would be great for going out for drinks or doing anything where you avoid greasy food. Also, the instructions on the box are in Chinese.

What I like about this set is that you get three different colors with this set, in case you need to blend to match your brow color (you can always give away the ones you don't use), and that it includes an eyeliner as well. Both worked well (they weren't dried out for me at all), flowing easily and with good lasting power. A great set for the price.

I've read about these and wanted to give them a try; you wet them with warm water (or micellar water) then wipe with off your makeup with them. They really do work, and feel so nice since they're very soft! Sometimes I press them gently against my eyes for a moment or two to help remove the more stubborn makeup, or gently rub. You wash once they're full of makeup, putting them in a garment bag, and I try to put them in a wash with no fabric softener.

This is a great makeup sponge and works just as well as others that cost a lot more. You can use it damp or dry (I moisten it when I'm applying liquid foundation, but can use it dry when cleaning up eye shadow or applying some blush). It's nice and soft so it feels good against the skin, and applies the makeup in an even fashion.

Okay, I love eyeshadow palettes and probably have too many, and they range in price and brand. I definitely love the 'sunset/rose gold' palettes, and this reminds me of a Huda palette I have with similar shades. It's in a slim, cardboard palette without a mirror, but this is a lower price point for all the shades you get. The shadow itself is a creamy powder blend, and it suggests that you use your fingers for the metallic shades (I find a small crease blush works fine and tends to have less loose powder that way).

You have a nice mix of matte and metallic shades this way, with a lot of earth tones. Definitely a lot of copper and reds here, some golds and rose golds and pinks. Colors that will stand out but not all of them. These felt nice on the skin and blended well. Why the three stars?

I tried this with and without primer, and this kit definitely needs primer to last more than a couple of hours on my skin. Also? The mattes will last several hours, but not the metallics even with primer (as well as a setting spray on top). I love the metallic colors, but they just fade on me somehow - even if I layer them on top of the matte. I'm used to eyeshadow blending on me after a few hours, but never have I seen metallics melt away on me like this. That's not to mean it won't work better on other people.

Still, for the price it's a nice range of colors and a fun palette to play with, so it's worth a try.

I've heard of face cream made from snails (or their secretions) and was a bit hesitant to give it a try. This is from Korea so perhaps that's not so surprising, and has a nice citrus scent to it, is a nice thick cream (no SPF) that does a really good job moisturizing my skin. It absorbs quickly and gives it a nice, dewy look and does seem to provide some tightness to it.

I'm pretty happy about the LumaRx facial cleansing brush. It is designed very ergonomically and is very comfortable to hold during use. The tool is extremely lightweight and has a tapered design which makes it so comfortable to use. The instructions are to use it for a minute each morning and evening. It has illustrations which show you to spend 20 seconds on the right side and 20 seconds on the left side and 20 seconds on the T-zone. The tool will actually buzz gently when you should move to the next area. This is a great feature! It also comes with 3 brush heads; massage, sensitive and normal skin. I am using the sensitive for now and it is perfect for a gentle exfoliation. When I am finished with that minute, my skin just glows and feels so clean! Hopefully the heads do not need replaced quickly as I do not think they are yet available on Amazon or online. It also comes with a sleek charger that does not take up any room at all on the counter – this is important to me as I have a small bathroom. Also, the LumaRx comes with a very nice carrying case that will come in handy for an upcoming vacation.

I can't say enough good things about these versatile Wonder Clips by Handi Stitch.  I recently received a package of 50 of these with 10 large clips and have used them on a daily basis for so much more than just holding fabric together for stitching seams.  Even this small size holds together leather so I find that I don't need to rubber cement the pieces together as I have done in the past to hold the pieces together.  Kids love these, too, so be prepared to find that you need more than you ever anticipated.  I received samples for evaluation and love these clips.

eb5 line has been around for some time now and I have noticed their advertisements in print media over the years, but have not tried any of the line until I received this bottle of Collagen Booster Serum.  I am very surprised that I like this serum as much as I do, and I am more surprised at the competitive pricing for the entire line.  With no added fragrance, my sensitive skin responded well to the light and creamy product that was readily absorbed.  My skin was prepared for moisturizing and there was no irritation or annoyance due to a fragrance of the natural components which can occur.  The pump action is terrific and the cap keeps it protected from the elements, yet it is quick to remove for application.  There is no excessive packaging, so little waste.  Many years ago, Robert Heldfond Jr. and I were casual friends in San Francisco, occasionally having coffee together in North Beach, and I have thought of him each time I would see his father's picture in the advertisements I mentioned earlier.  I very much like to support family businesses and am pleased to finally try the product from his company which now has his wife at the helm.  I look forward to trying other products in the line.

Plastic and/or acrylic organizers come in all sizes, shapes, configurations and qualities. MelodySusie® has blown me away with this three part, multiple sectioned organizer with drawers. Just so you're clear, you get a base with four drawers, each with an flattened oval shaped pull, each lined with a black textile that can be removed or used as you choose. The edges of the drawers are beveled, giving this an aura of elegance, but most importantly, each drawer slides in and out with ease, regardless of whether or not the drawer is packed or empty. The bottom of the base has a little strip in the form which raises this organizer from sitting directly on the counter, so if it is used in a bathroom, air can circulate around the entire piece and grungy mildew and such is reduced from forming. Don't forget to dust, though. The exterior edges are beveled, giving them a very finished appearance, unlike those sharp edges on many similar products in the marketplace.

Included with this organizer are two additional pieces, each is the same dimension as the interior of the top ridge of the chest organizer, so you can decide which one you want to put on top and which one you want to put next to the main component. Or you can separate them entirely and use the top of the organizer to put items and use the two multi-sectioned components separately. You could line them up side by side along a dresser top and have more width rather than extended height.

I love the assorted sizes of the sections and the angles top of the shorter of the two pieces. I also love the rounded design in the sections of the taller component. Every aspect of this trio is outstanding, high quality, and it makes quite the impression in addition to comfortably storing whatever you like in each compartment. Each edge is finished, every detail has been considered, and it is even practical in that it can quickly be cleaned with no harsh detergents. This lovely item was made in China and it is clear that quality control is important to the manufacturer because I saw no defect even after intense examination. Be prepared for a weightier set than you might expect, because there was no skimping on the materials. It is perfectly packed for protection and is ideal for presenting as a gift. It is well worth its price point. A sample was provided for review.

Purchased these to travel international without checking in luggage. Different countries have varying standards on liquids in carry on luggage and no matter what country, these containers will meet those standards. If you use these for an over night stay somewhere, or have an unexpected stay at an airport hotel, they should be able to hold enough supplies for that, but not for more than maybe 2 days.

They are sturdy plastic, opaque containers and are flexible enough to squeeze the contents out. The caps are push in type and is better than the lift up caps where the cover can easily break off. Like a previous reviewer mentioned, when you buy other travel container sets, I find that a few of the containers are useless, like the spray bottle and the little "pill" container with the screw off lid, at least for my needs. This particular set has all of the type of containers that I needed, and more than enough for all the products that I carry.
Buy these. They feel great and work quickly! So good for a quick refresh or self care night

This is, I think, my third order of Rio De Keratin. I'm able to get 3-4 treatments out of each kit with my hair ranging from super short to just below my shoulders. I usually still iron my hair, but it stays flat, even in Alabama's subtropical humidity. Otherwise, it doesn't matter what I do: by the time I walk from my house to the car, my hair is frizztastic. But with a keratin treatment, I can even just blow dry my hair and it look fantastic. This saves so much more time and it makes styling last for days. I also hike and get sweaty and my hair still looks great after it dries. Once, after a day of kayaking, I rode in the back of a friend's truck back to the marina, and my hair still looked terrific. This of all things has given me the hair I've dreamed of. And at $10-$15 per treatment, this price is right.

Of course, it does smell terrible. And the fumes can sting your eyes, both as you apply it to your hair and as you iron it out. I like to open the back door and aim a cyclonic fan into the bathroom while I use this stuff so I don't choke on the fumes.

Since there aren’t any reviews for this product, I thought I would write one for those who aren’t familiar with the brand, or the item. I’m now 66 years old and have been using only La Prairie products for my face since 2009/10. My face looks better than ever because of it. This item in particular is a very gentle, easy to apply and use, facial cleanser that doesn’t require any water or actual washing process. It goes on a cotton pad (not the balls!), and not too much either, and you gently wipe your face and eye lids going in a circular motion - and always apply outwards and upwards. This will help your skin from being pulled down, which can cause more wrinkles. The company has changed the exact name of the product, but it’s the same (only an improved version) as it always has been. For me, I use this as the first step in my nightly facial ritual - which is to cleanse the face. I follow with other products in stages, finishing up with the moisturizer (one for the face and a different one for the eyes). My rating of this being sold online is hard, since it’s a wonderful product, however it’s outrageously overpriced for what’s a ‘trial size’ and ‘free’ gift, given out with purchases of a full size La Prairie item (depending on how much you spend, and where you buy, it might be just one of multiple free trial size items). The FULL size of this item is about $100 USD, and it’s around 8 ounces +/-. The bottle is probably 8” high and a couple inches wide at least. So part of my rating is based on the product itself and the other part is on the price for this size. Another thing I want to mention is that I have sensitive skin and have never had any issues with this product line! You’re face will thank you!

I liked this particular scent much more than others that I've tried, from both Michel Design and other brands. The peony has a distinctive smell to it but unfortunately it doesn't last long enough after taking a shower. The bar is a large oval shape and a little awkward to use at first - it gets easier as it's used more. The design of this and other products from MDW is very pretty and would make a nice gift for someone too. The soap has a LOT of creamy lather that that rinses clean and doesn't leave much soap scum on the shower walls. I have tried other triple milled soaps from L'Occitaine, Pre de Provence, Australian Soap Works, and 2 others that I can't readily recall the name of. All these are similar in price but the quality of this is much better, at least in my opinion. I have found that some fragrances are a bit stronger than others and I think it's just a matter of choosing one over another according to preference. This company makes so many different things for the kitchen and bath and I have bought quite a number of them for myself and plan on buying more for gifts. I noticed one review of this scent that said it had an awful smell to it, whereas mine is good - unfortunately this can happen if the bar is old and depending on the seller. This doesn't mean that every bar of soap is bad! My only negative comment is that the peony scent doesn't last long enough!

This is one of La Prairie's less expensive moisturizers and it's good. It can be used day and/or night alone or over a serum or one of their other products per directions. I use this cream during the day because I don't really need a sunscreen. I've also used this at night when I run out of night cream. In my opinion all of La Prairie's products are excellent and worth the high price - I don't use makeup so it's important for me to make my face look as good as it can be. I'm 61 years old and have been using this line for about 7 years. Depending on skin type and age I think some of their products work better than others. As with all their products a little goes a long way. The current price on Amazon is quite a bit lower than what I have to pay in a department store which is more than $200 for the same size jar!
The title says it all. I love this stuff. Worth the hefty price. Thank you, Camille Beckman.

use a tiny amount with my eye cream. If you are not accustomed to using glycolic acid be careful with this brand. It is very potent. I suggest mixing a small amount with a moisterizer. I do that for my neck. A bit of redness and peeling is common. I will absolutely order again.

I had high hopes for this little baby, but after using for a few days, I must say it's just "okay". Perhaps it may be because when I bought it I had thick (or used to before my brush starting feasting on it) hair down to my butt and was tired of finding enough to knit my cat a sweater in my hair brush every morning. So I wanted something that was more user friendly. But then on an impulse I cut my naturally curly hair very short.

The Pros: It seems sturdy and well-made with a nice grain. It's smooth (the teeth on the plastic picks tend to splinter and peel with time). It feels comfortable to use. It probably has good stay power.

The Cons: By far the biggest for me is that the teeth are spaced much more widely apart and are much thicker than I expected from the photo. This means you can't really get the curl definition that the picks with a more narrow spacing will give you. I also wish the handle were a bit longer.

Let me begin this review by stating that I have been using Egyptian, Indian and Pakistani 100% henna for over 30 years with beautiful results that lasted a full 3 months.  I decided to try this product because I wanted a change from all the red highlights and thought it would be nice to tone down to a browner hue.  I not only followed the instructions to the letter, but had several exchanges with the seller to make sure what I was doing was correct.  The good news is that this combination beautifully toned down the red from all my prior years of using henna only.  The bad news is that NOT ONE gray hair (I'm dark brown with about 15% gray) gave up being gray! So in addition to the hassle, mess and expense of doing this treatment (and make no mistake - it's messy and time consuming) I will have to double up this month and do my regular henna only routine.  I did a bit of research, by the way, and learned that most henna/indigo distributors, unlike Harvest Moon, suggest mixing up the henna and indigo powders SEPARATELY and then combining.  Based on my experience, I'd have to say this would probably work better (the rationale probably being the same as why combining shampoo and conditioner together don't work as well as shampooing and THEN conditioning).  Likewise, everyone else except Harvest Moon recommends wrapping the hair in plastic wrap and then covering with a shower cap and leaving on for a MINIMUM of 2 hours (Harvest Moon says their product works in less than one hour and is against wrapping.)  Leaves me to wonder if the gray hairs would not be gray had I followed the advice of the other henna/indigo distributors.  Here's a good reference website:  [...]
