Hubby doesn't really need a great conditioner though since his hair is pretty short so we weren't to concerned about that. I tried the conditioner just to see and wasn't a fan. I have frizzy tangle prone hair and this just wasn't moisturizing enough. But I also usually buy conditioner specific to my hair type so I can't fault this one too much for not being it.

I ended up really liking these. I was a teen in the 90s and loved my scrunchies, so happy to see them making a comeback. These worked well in my thick hair, although the satin ones do loosen up a bit but only because the material is slippery. You can wear all day without getting that annoying hair pulled headache feeling.

I think my favorite are the middle ones, that have a small tail, they look super cute. They and the long ones are more of a scarf material. I've liked the whole set. Great for the price too.

Kiddo liked this, but probably because of the kid friendly scent. He isn't prone to burning so I had to try it as well, and it kept my very fair skin from getting red even after I got drenched from the hose repeatedly. I prefer a lotion feel than the gel, but he didn't mind the consistency. All and all it did what it was suppose to.

I tried a couple other charcoal peel off masks before this that were MUCH much easier to use, both a bit more expensive but neither crazy so. Luckily I had no issues with the bottle splitting like some others reported. Here is what I did not like about the product.

Issue #1: This one didn't peel off in nice big patches more like you had to chip away at it which was messy time consuming and harsher on my face than it needed to be.

Issue#2: It also was ineffective, it didn't unclog anything. At most it removed a top layer of dead skin making my skin feel softer (and dryer), but after rechecking my pores with a magnifying mirror (if you want to hate yourself buy one and then freak out at your skin, lol) there was no real difference. The before and after of my pores under the mirror were nearly identical.

So all that work and annoyed skin for nothing. Mostly though I was just aggravated that it came apart in a million little shreds rather than actually just peel off my skin. That's the best part, booooo.

This thing was great and worked as well as my Diva Darling microfiber hair towel. I'm not sure I'd call any of the microfiber towels rapid drying but they do pull out more moisture and create less frizz than a standard bath towel. I have super thick wavy (coughFrizzycough) hair that is just past my shoulders, and I had plenty of room to spare with this towel. It could easily work for even longer thicker hair.

It wrapped so easily and really stayed put with the little elastic band in the back. My other is a standard towel so you have to twist and tuck and hope it stays. Not with these, super secure. Plus, there is 4 of them so I never have to time laundry and shower again.

Highly recommend.
This product arrived broken and it is not letting me file a return/exchange because it says no returns!
I love the side pieces on these clip in bangs extension. They make it so much easier to blend with your natural hair. I don’t have enough hair for bangs so this was the perfect solution.

This Stride Foot Cream comes in a little tub. It’s quite thick and felt a touch touch greasy going on. It instantly softened my feet and smoothed my dry skin. It absorbs fairly quickly. I just don’t think I would pay $27 for such a small tub of it.

After extensive patch testing I discovered that this eye corrector serum works great on my sensitive skin! I love the pump. It goes on smooth and smells amazing. I haven’t noticed a difference in my eye puffiness but I think it helps my dark circles and it’s nice and moisturizing.
I love these lashes and have already went in for seconds

It's not the best I've ever used, but at the price point it's good. The main thing is to be careful not to use too much at first as it takes very little. That took some adjusting to. I might stick with this one for a while. It's pretty good.

The smell is overwhelming, the worst I've ever encountered in a hair dye. I'd suggest keeping the windows open and use a fan.

It's easy to use, pretty much the same instructions as any other hair dye I've tried. For best results, it's important to do the allergy and stand tests as instructed. Also follow the instructions about not massaging It into the scalp. It burns a little if that happens.

It covers grey well. It lightened dark blond hair somewhat, and produced an uneven time, which is part of the point, but which seemed a little erratic for my taste.
Works well on my tail bone length hair.  I use it to comb my hair after a shower when it is wet.  Great for massaging the scalp too.  Attractive.  Sturdy.  No complaints or regrets.

I am familiar with the Kopari brand.  They are considered a "clean beauty" brand with less toxins than most.  This is a fun little set.  Not overly sticky.  Imparts a nice shine and makes lips feel good.  Non drying.  These would make a great gift.  No complaints or regrets.

Did not make a difference on my middle-aged, normal to dry skin.  Applied well.  Not sticky, but did not make skin soft or have any noticeable changes.  First ampoule shattered in my hand.  Small pieces of glass everywhere and then I was afraid of rubbing tiny fragments of glass into my face.  Instructions are also not good on how to open them properly.  Not super impressed and I normally like many Babor products.

Chose this to replace an older one my husband had that got left outside too long.  This is excellent on horses and also goats, both of which we have.  Horses seem to like being brushed this way.  Actually works well on cats and dogs too, but it is a little rougher and sometimes scares them.  My little cat though loved the gloves though.  The groomer is well made.  As good of quality as the other name brand one we had.  No complaints or regrets on this set.

Surprisingly like this.  "Romance" ends up being a more neutral and not an in your face color.  I have light to medium cool undertoned skin.  Goes on shimmery purple, wipes off to a pinky / coraly / red. Stays all day.  I usually use it under other lipstick so when the lipstick fades there is still color there.  I have sensitivities to chemical and toxins and this does not seem to bother me that I immediately see.  Overall ... no regrets.  Better than expected.
Good sharp scissors.  Have not seen any rusting on these.  Feel good in my hands.  Cut well.  Good quality hair cutting scissors.  No regrets.

[[VIDEOID:5c532f5f5d94b55721fdf6748ddcc641]] I want you to try these for two reasons, first of all because I often make my own DIY cosmetics, including lip balms and glosses. These applicators are perfect to use with those.
Also, have you ever found that perfect shade of lipstick that you can't live without, only to find that it's been discontinued? These applicators help get every last bit of lipstick out of a tube so that you can enjoy it longer.
As you can see, the colors are pretty bright. I think that these would look more upscale in more muted colors, and if that's what you're going for, I would suggest getting the other color option in these. To be honest, what I would prefer, is if they were paper or wood instead of plastic. A little more environmentally friendly.
Still, they're good for what they are. The doe-foot tip Is slanted, just like with your favorite tubed liquid lip products. They are fuzzy, so they hold the lip product.
Makeup artists, as well as their clientele, will appreciate that these can be used once and then tossed. No spreading of germs and bacteria.

Not only are these sheets good for do-it-yourself masks, but they're fabulous at making any good serum a high-end mask.
What I like to do is open one of the individual packets and pull out the tablet, which is a compressed mask. And then, I take very hot water in order to get it to open up. After cleansing my face, I will load it with serum, and then put the warm mask over my face. It's easy to pat it into your skin to make it stay.
Lean back and relax, I generally do it for half an hour.
Remove the mask and gently massage the remaining serum into your face, and continue with your facial routine of moisturizer, sunscreen, whatever you use next.
So, whether you dip them in pineapple juice, apple cider vinegar, or whatever your DIY routine is, or you use a prepared serum from your favorite brand, these are convenient, easy to use, and relatively inexpensive.
I especially like the individual packaging because they stay sanitary. I can pop a couple of them in my makeup bag and always be ready to go on any adventure that requires an overnight stay.
Thanks for reading.

Definitely a clean fragrance that's fine for anyone.
To me, the scent is pettigrain, orange blossoms.
As you would expect, it doesn't have a lot of longevity. But after application it's quite uplifting. Not overpowering.
Absolutely suitable for babies and toddlers, as well as teens and moms.

From pin-up girls to starlets, from old Hollywood movie queen royalty to the girls at the automat, certain red lipsticks have dominated makeup counters for decades.
This is one of them.

Everything about this lipstick, except for the modern wearability, is vintage glamour. The shape of the tube and the shape of the lipstick itself harkens to another era. Perfect for making the ultimate Cupid's bow pout. It even has that slight fragrance that will remind you of vintage lipsticks.

I normally wear red that has a little more blue in it, so was surprised that this clear red was fine for me. To me that says that it will flatter a wide range of skin tones.
After swiping it on my wrist and then wiping it away, it left a nice stain. If you aren't interested in that drop dead gorgeous look and want something a little more subtle, it does double duty by leaving a pinky red stain when blotted. But go for the high voltage dramatic red if you want to be noticed.

Very comfortable lipstick, but I didn't have a problem with it bleeding. Non-drying and non-cracking. Opaque coverage with one swipe.
Another plus, it makes your teeth look super white.
I hope that this review as well as the photographs can help you to make a decision about this lipstick. It's really hard buying such things online, especially when it comes to luxury brands like this.

If you don't want to think about having to touch up your liner all day, and I mean ALL day, you'll love this clever eyeliner.
Dual tips means you have one product that gives you 100% precision.
If you like to get artistic, if you like to play with your makeup, those tips are so much fun and you can create so many looks. From slim cat eye to thick Cleopatra.
Very nice, definitely a keeper.

I got these because they have aloe vera.  I have sensitive skin and these do a nice job of gentle cleaning, low odor with no ill effects.  They are also nice and portable as I can put them in my bag when I travel.

As a big fan of hair masks, this is one of the better ones that I've used.
I have fine and fragile hair, that is thinning due to heredity and age. This mask smooths it down and makes it look to be in better condition.
Even the ends don't look as fly away.
If you have hair with issues, this is a good product to try.

After taking this wig out and giving it a good shake, the cut on this is fantastic! It's the super trendy wolf cut.
The color is fun, but I have no problem wearing this wig out and about.

The built-in brush makes this product easy to apply. If you need to put your makeup on in a hurry, this stuff is really great.
You can control how much comes out onto the brush and then use the brush to apply it evenly. It works as well as most primers in that it hides some of the medium, if not the large, pores.
Easy to tuck in your makeup bag.

This review is for the large size. The size is something you might want to consider if you have thin or fine hair. Just know what you're getting.

They hold well and are super cute.

These are wonderful for freshening up face and hands. On the box, it's suggests that you can wipe down surfaces. They aren't antibacterial, and they don't clean, but they will leave a nice refreshing scent. On many surfaces, they will leave streaks, as well as not really cleaning.
I suggest using them mainly as a quick way to clean your hands on the go without alcohol or chemicals that you might not want on your skin.

Perhaps it's just me, but I found this product to be very artificial looking. Nothing natural about it including the color.
Please keep in mind that it might be just the right color for you, but this didn't make my salt and pepper brows look any better.

It's probably happened to just about every busty woman.
You're wearing a top, and are justn't even particularly revealing but it might be a little loose. You bend down, and when you look up you notice somebody's eyes popping out of their head because you've showed more than a little cleavage when you bent down. Especially if you weren't wearing a bra!
This helps not only to keep those situations in check, but it also helps when a button is at the wrong area and creates a gap.
Not just for movie stars wearing super revealing fashions!

This set is good because these types of tools wear out quickly. It doesn't make sense to spend a lot of money on them because you're going to have to replace them frequently.
If it's a really cold night, unbelievably, a horse can get an undercoat just that quick. The gloves are important to get that undercoat in check, all year long.

I actually hadn't intended on doing a before and after photograph, but there was such a difference after I massaged this lotion into my hands, that I wanted to show you how much of a difference it made. With just one application.
Now I understand why this is used at hospitals. It is amazingly effective as well as being allergen-free. Steroid free. Fragrance free. There's a little bit of a natural aroma of the ingredients but it is not offensive. It smells like just about every other fragrance-free product The big difference is that this one is way more effective than most other products of this type that I've tried. This is one that makes me wish I had given the others lower ratings. It's that good.
Not high priced. No splashy logos. Just an extremely effective lotion for extremely dry skin.

Although this is a pretty cheaply made set, it actually does the job reasonably well. Not just for puppies. I have a standard poodle that has a curly coat that is cropped for the summer. It works very well on his tight curls.

For some reason, it's hard to find extensions in this color. It seems that anything with a mixed gray isn't very popular, or at least not popular enough to mass produce.
That's a shame because it's gorgeous. Not only if you have gray hair, but if you want a really interesting contrast color.
Clip-ins are easy to use if you are a novice.
This goes on dark, but doesn't deposit enough color for me. If you like just a subtle look, it's fine. I confess that I use it without rinsing it out because otherwise the color isn't enough for me.

You can't beat these for adding some volume and thickness. There's a bit of a learning curve but thankfully there are plenty of YouTube videos out there to help you with installation, even if you're doing it by yourself. It helps to have two mirrors so that you can see the back of your head.
Very pretty and a good value.

I love the chocolate and chestnut colors of this silky wig.
When you first remove it from the netting, there's a lot of static so you do need to spray it down before wearing it. It's one of the better scalps on wigs of this price range, as you can see in the photograph. Not as fake looking as most.
In my opinion it's a very good wig for the money.

This is a Place on, Pat on mask.
You remove the mask and carefully place it on your face and smooth it down, and leave it on for about half an hour. While it's on it feels just delightful. It contains hyaluronic acid on a biocellulose sheet that clings to your face. It's as if you can feel all that good stuff soaking into your skin. Also contains ceramides, another skin-loving component.
After removal there's no need to rinse. You simply pat any remaining solution into your skin.
A great way to pamper yourself as well as nourish your face.

Although I had to trim the bangs a little bit as they were too long, this is a very pretty wig that has natural gray coloring.
The hair itself is soft. Other than trimming the bangs, it's ready to wear right out of the package.

Packaged perfectly for gift-giving, these hand lotion tubes are not the most hydrating when it is compared to long-lasting healing creams, but the light fragrance is delightful.
And don't get me wrong, these will leave your hands soft and moisturized. I just found I had to reapply a few times throughout the day to get the hydration I like.

Definitely not for the professional, or for precise work at home, but good enough for little touch-ups.
The price reflects the quality, or vice versa, so it still gets four stars. If the price were higher, it would be different.
The tip of the cutting scissors is not to a point, but the blunt isn't filed down either. So these are going to need the same amount of care that you don't poke someone's eye out as you would with a needle point scissors. Kind of defeats the purpose of them having been blunted.
Comfortable enough for my average size female hands, and a nice feature is the rubber nub that keeps it from clacking together as you close the scissors.

Decent enough but wish they were sharper, especially at the ends. I use the ends of the snipper to do hang nails and trim the corners of the fingernail itself. Granted I use them for more than cuticles, which wears them out faster, but when I think of the name Soligen I expect a product of superior quality.

Clip-ins are so convenient. And I find that they're one of the easiest types of extensions if you're doing it yourself, without anyone else to help you.
For the money, you'd be hard pressed to find better extensions. The hair is very nice, the color is stunning.
The clips are nice and sturdy, I expect no problems with them in the future.
It's important to remember to wash them carefully. Dip in water that has a little mild shampoo, and gently squeeze. Carefully lift up and place in fresh water.

Highly fragranced set, beautifully hand packed with tissue.
You can order this with confidence if you are giving it as a gift, because an outer cardboard box protects the gift box itself from any shipping damage.
Just opening it up is a delight. The aroma is soothing with natural fragrance. Not a hint of off chemical odors, just fresh essential oils, blended for a peaceful experience.
I especially like the petite candle that is a lovely way to complete the experience. You can have a candle lit bath using the bath gel, and spray the linens with the pillow spray for a calming and sleep inducing experience.

Very caring gift for someone facing challenges and stress

Love the way this balm and conditioner is fragranced. If you like oud, with it's mysteriously sensual scent of woodsy incense, this is for you.
The jar looks uniquely elegant.
Although it's a solid balm, it melts easily in your hands. In shipping, it looks like it seperated a bit, right down to staining the presentation box.
While that might be an issue if giving as a gift, it does not affect the quality or use.
A little goes a long way, and that amazing scent stays on a good while.

These little tubes of hand cream make wonderful gifts because they are packaged each in a special little box. Great stockers or just a little token of appreciation.
This review is for the olive variety.
I didn't find it to be the most moisturizing hand cream that I've tried but it isn't too bad. Considering that it's so giftable, I feel that it's definitely worth the money. You can always try one before you give away the others.
Very light fragrance suitable for just about anyone.

I'm so glad but finally the United States is getting access to some of the top skincare in the world that originates in Korea.
As the listing states, these are gentle exfoliating pads that peel away and dissolve microscopic dead skin gradually and gently. Within a week you can see brighter healthier skin that was hiding under the surface.
And it does it all without irritation!
As with any acidic facial care product, it's important to remember sunscreen if you go out.

I found this mask to be quite comfortable as well as easy to breathe through. Suitable for any gender, and it's even a little stylish with an on-trend color as well as a very helpful strap. Now when I choose to take it off, I can have it hanging around my neck, ready to pull it back up if necessary. The ear loops are adjustable with a little bead that by now most of us are familiar with using.
It claims to be antimicrobial because of some copper content. It's also quick drying as well as offering UV protection.
Made in Korea.

This line uses the well-researched benefits of olive in order to create a skin care that rejuvenates and heals. This particular product is great for morning puffy eyes. I keep it in a cosmetics cooler in the bathroom so that it's colder than room temperature when I pat it on.
Makes you look bright eyed and ready for the day, even if you had a rough night.

I like these so much that I purchased more.
This German skin care line is one of my favorites because of the quality of ingredients and the effectiveness of the product.
No irritation, even around my sensitive eyes.
The serum preps your skin for the next step of skin care, such as moisturizer. Your day or night cream sinks into your skin better, creating a noticeable difference in fine lines.

Harnessing the power of olive, these are wonderfully skin soothing drops. Not only do they moisturize, but they seem to heal minor irritations such as the little red spots that I get.
Expensive, but definitely worth it, especially on little imperfections that you wish would heal faster

You can pay a pretty penny for a skin care product that has a percentage of squalane in it, but this is 100% squalane.
I really like that this is plant based, as opposed to being derived from sharks, after all the result is the same.
A few drops and parched skin is instantly soft with just a touch of glow. Or you can mix it with any other skincare product or even a foundation, in order to make it more hydrating.
No fragrance whatsoever, so scent sensitive people will love this.
Another thing to appreciate is that the bottle and dropper are both glass.

Bottom line:
On its own or as an additive in a DIY creation, this may be clear, but it's liquid gold.

It really IS like a mild Botox treatment!
Ummm, I may or may not know that from personal experience, haha!
Okay, yes, I know it from personal experience.
As a little background, paracress has been long used as an anti-inflammatory and numbing herb, it's even called the toothache herb.
It also 'numbs', as in relaxes, the skin.
Guess what, that's exactly how Botox works.
While it isn't going to have nearly the same dramatic effect, I found it to be enough of the difference to where this is always going to be in my makeup/skincare bag.
Clinical trials using it in this way have indicated that it works on all but about 25% of the participants, so there's a chance it might not work for you. I'm thrilled to be in the percent that it did.
It has some of the same chemical components as Szechuan pepper, which has got to be safer than the botulism in Botox, right?

Paracress is almost unheard of outside of Brazil. This will be our little secret!
For reference, I'm in my early 60s. I've always taken care of my skin and stayed out of the sun, so I probably have fewer wrinkles than most people my age, but trust me, I've got them.

Hopefully this review will help you to make a decision about whether or not you'd like to make the rather substantial investments in this product. It's definitely a risk since it doesn't work for everyone. And I can't stress enough that it's not going to be super dramatic change. But heck, I'm excited at even small changes.

xxoo

Although I'm not thrilled that this didn't have a safety seal on it, the cream itself is very good. It's a heavy cream, despite the company identifying it as being light and whipped. It looks whipped in the jar, but it is not light on the face. I don't think it would be suitable for all ages. Because of the heaviness and intense moisturizing, I believe that mature skin is going to benefit most from using this.
For reference, I'm in my early 60s, in a dry climate, with combination skin (T Zone) and some wrinkles as a point of concern.
This cream works very well with all of the above. I don't put it on my nose, of course, but when I feel like a splurge I put it on my hands because it's so moisturizing.
The claim that it moisturizes 24/7 is indeed true. Even in this dry area, my face feels hydrated all day when I use this cream.
It contains milk protein, yogurt extract, blueberry extract, rice protein, and a host of other skin-loving ingredients.

I hope this review has helped you to make a decision about whether or not you'd like to invest in this product. It is indeed generously sized at 3.4 oz, and it has a very high quality ingredients. But like I said, it's not going to be for everyone.

xxoo

Do you like champagne cocktails? This one smells like a combination of peach and champagne, and even looks like it!
It comes out like a gel. It's activated by water, so after washing your face, leave your face damp and put a thin layer of the gel quickly all over your face. Include your neck if you like.
Then with each passing moment, it's going to get foamier and foamier. That's why you have to have a very thin coat. You only need a small amount of product. If you use too much, your face is going to foam up like you have shaving cream all over!

After about 5 or 10 minutes, you massage a little bit with warm water and then rinse. After you dry your face it's going to feel squeaky clean. If you have dry skin, you're ready for a moisturizing serum and cream. If you have oily or acne prone skin, use the appropriate products for that skin type. I don't feel that this mask is drying, but it does leave you very clean.

So, in my opinion, this is good for all skin types, as long as you use it as a brightening mask as opposed to a hydrating mask.
This is just what your skin needs if you have overdosed on hot humid weather.please look at the ingredients to see if you have any sort of allergy or if any of them are a trigger for any skin issues. Because I have sensitive skin that can be triggered, but I only left it on for about 4 minutes. I had absolutely no irritation, but I think if I had left it on longer, I might have. That doesn't mean it's bad for you. If you leave a mild castile soap, which is so gentle, on your face for any length of time, skin will be irritated.
Made in the USA, from Tonica Skin in Marblehead Massachusetts.

I hope this review has helped you to make a decision about whether or not you'd like to try this fun mask. It really does leave your skin feeling and looking energized, but it's a bit of an investment. Nice splurge for a spa night, and because the product comes out via a pump, it's going to be sanitary for all the participants.
It's going to make for some really fun and Instagram worthy photos!

xxoo

PS, my 'spa night' pal doesn't look too impressed 😆

Having never used a micro-needle patch before, but often using a derm roller, I expected some discomfort, but that wasn't the case.
Although there was not a huge difference, there was indeed a difference.
When you stop using them, you will be back at square one, but there is definitely a softening of lines for about a week after the treatments.

This is pure genius.
After unscrewing the top of the cap, you'll see the film that protects the batteries. After you remove it, put the top back on and separate the light unit from the jar.
The red LED light will be activated by pressing against your skin. Does that light actually do anything, or is it a gimmick?
There are a number of high-priced red light units on the market. They were first used in dermatologist offices and med spas. When they first came out, I had a red Tanda unit. This is exactly the same concept, and yes, you will have a slight difference.
The amount of cream gone in the jar has been for about 10 applications. I do it at night so I can relax while holding the unit at various places on my face. The red light goes on when you press slightly on the metal ring, as you can see in the photographs. As you press it to the area of your face that you want treated, slide it from the middle of your face outward, for 3 minutes. Then go to the next area. This way you get a little bit of a lymphatic massage. If you suffer with sinus headaches, this action is very good at offering some relief.
The cream is very lightly fragranced with a fresh scent. It's a gel or mousse type of cream.
After purchasing this, you can get the cream refill.

So much cheaper than buying an LED light device like a Tanda.

I'm a sucker for beautiful packaging.
Here we have a gorgeous tea canister that is well made and beautiful. It also closes tightly, keeping my tea fresh. A good tea canister is not cheap, so I didn't have sticker shock with this product.

Thankfully, the company thoughtfully puts out refill packs of this delicious and calming tea.
I'll definitely be ordering a refill because not only do I like it myself, but after going through so many different calming and sleep inducing teas, this is my spouse's absolute favorite. Not just because of the taste, but it helps her to totally relax and even sleep throughout the night. Other teas and sleep formulations such as melatonin and valerian supplements just don't do the trick.
For me, it's more about the delightful taste. Slightly floral, slightly sweet. Yes, it does relax me and is helpful as part of a nighttime ritual, but not as much as my spouse. We both love it but for different reasons.

And I just adore the look of the canister. A lovely gloss ceramic, with an Art Deco nod, that fits in any decor. No hiding it, it's proudly on the counter, ready for anytime you need a little tea comfort.

This brand of mask is not off the chart expensive, but it's always helpful to try things out before making the big investment.
What a terrific way to try the various masks that this company offers! The quad pack includes skin resurrection for rejuvenating, chillax for calming, magic mushroom for moisturizing, and glow and go for brightening.
Perfect for a pajama parties with a spa theme!
The ingredients are similar in all of them. They all contain skin-loving aloe vera as well as cucumber extract, and even manuka honey. And all of them are pleasantly scented and very refreshing to use.

When skin is stressed, every little thing bothers it. Too much heat, too much cold, too much wind, too much dry air.
Those of us with sensitive skin know exactly what stressed out skin is. We need something that will soothe, without any irritation.
This particular cream hit that goal for me. I used it during a rosacea flare up, to help the redness and discomfort calm down. It worked very well. Not a miracle, but it worked well.
If you have skin like mine, I hope it works for you.

I wanted this oil because it's a blend that contains both lavender and patchouli. I absolutely adore patchouli, although some products that contain it don't have that wonderful incense sent.
This blend is delightful. You get the patchouli and spicy lavender mixed with a little bit of citrus as well as yang yang. There is even a touch of nutmeg to add even more warm spice.
I also love the elegant dropper, so much nicer than a rubber dropper. The gold top has a button that depresses to dispense a drop at a time.
A very special oil. You don't need a carrier because it's already in skin-loving avocado oil.
It has a shrink wrap to protect against contamination, as well as to assure that you've gotten a brand new product. Very important to me.
Oils can go rancid quickly, and this manufacturer puts an expiration date on the bottom. Any product that can go rancid should have that, but not all do, so that's another great thing about this oil.

Anything that helps during these stressful times, even a little, is important.
This has a delightfully soothing scent. Perfect blend for a moment of calm.
Nice little gift to send to a loved one that is feeling stressed or anxious.

Most wigs in this price range look, well, wiggy.
When I'm wearing a colorful or super fun hairstyle in a wig, and people can assume rightly that it's a wig, I have no problem with that. I love wearing wigs that look like wigs.
But once in awhile, you just want to blend in with the crowd, and wear a wig that simply looks like you've got great hair.
Wigs like that generally cost a heck of a lot more than this one. Was really surprised to see how natural this one looks. In a lot of situations, and by that I mean if it isn't windy or super bright sunshine, no one would think this is a wig. That makes it perfect for shopping, work, and most situations.
I find this style to be nearly universally flattering on everyone. It doesn't matter if you have a chubby face or a thin face, this style is classic because most people can wear it.
Another thing to like is that this wig doesn't get tangled as long as you keep it on a wig stand.
Very good value for a very cute wig.

Feathers can be a little controversial. Rest assured that these are cruelty free! I used to have a peacock as a pet. He shed those beautiful tail feathers every year, and even though he is long gone I still have some of his gorgeous plumes. Peacock feathers are not harvested from the animal, you simply pick them up as they are naturally shed.
This set arrived in a plastic bag. When I pulled the pieces out, there were three peacock feather pieces and one headband. Each feather piece has a rhinestone accent at the bottom. One is all rhinestone, one is a pearl surrounded by rhinestones, and one is a London blue stone surrounded by rhinestones.
Of the two larger pieces, one has an alligator clip hot glued onto the felt backing, and one has a strip of grossgrain ribbon glued to the back. Although I'm not sure, I suspect that it was at one time glued to the headband, or they leave it to the consumer to glue it to the headband. I tried to push the end of the headband through the middle of the ribbon, thinking that perhaps it could slide on, but it is glued completely, you can't slide it onto the headband.
The smaller piece also has an alligator type clip of the same size as the larger clipped piece. They stay beautifully in your hair and are actually comfortable.

I wouldn't call this a glamor or fashion accessory set, it's definitely a costume set that would be great for a roaring twenties party. Each one would also be a fun addition to a hat. I wear a lot of hats and love to adorn them with scarves and feathers.

The following is not part of my review but it is a kind of funny peacock story. naturally, when guests came over they wanted to see him with his tail spread out in beautiful peacock glory. They only open up like that when they're trying to impress someone, and he certainly was never impressed by any of my guests. At the time I also had a miniature pig. That peacock was so in love with the pig that whenever she came near him he would spread out his feathers and shake them hoping she would notice and return his love. Of course that never happened, the pig could care less. But whenever we wanted to show him off to our friends, we would walk the pig over to him and he would immediately open his tail feathers with a great flourish! My friends and I were all impressed. Maggie the pig was not.

My experience with Middle Eastern perfume has been that they are usually heavily reliant on woods, resins, and incense notes. Very sensual, very provacative.
This offering blends in florals and juicy ripe fruits in the dry down.
That sounds like it wouldn't work, but it does.
The fresh musk gives way to a sexy, feminine aroma.
If I were to create a magazine ad for this perfume, it would be a woman with tousled hair, still between the soft bedsheets, satisfied smile on her face. Like I said, provacative.

I love the concept of an individual towelette, not only for convenience, but because I can go from fragrance free to smelling delicious in a heartbeat. Lunch with someone sensitive to perfume and dinner with someone who isn't.
That being said, I believe that this delivery system lends itself better to lighter fragrances.
On unwrapping the packet, you smell a dark, bitter chocolatey, red wine kind of note. Definitely unique. Usually gourmand fragrances are geared for youth, but this is all grown up and adult.
Too intense for warm weather, ok for fall and winter.

I'm in my early 60s, with slight rosacea under my eyes and a couple of red spidery veins around my nose. My spouse is on blood thinners, and bruises easily.
The small amount I show on my hand is the amount I need for my rosacea and around my nose. Not very much at all. It did not happen overnight but it did calm the rosacea down, and while they have not all disappeared, the tiniest of the tiny red lines are gone. Gone!
This cream has also helped those pesky bruises disappear more quickly.

The product contains all of the wonderful herbal and botanical ingredients well-known for healing skin, such as arnica Montana flower, green tea, and chamomile extracts.
The flip cap opens easily, just in case you have any hand difficulties and are curious about that. You need to unscrew the flip cap and remove the safety seal, then screw the cap back on. I can't say this enough, I love a product with a safety seal!
I even like the packaging. Various plants and flowers on a celadon background.

It's hereditary. Just like my mother, my nose is peppered with large pores. After makeup application, foundation sinks into them making them even more obvious at times.
These products work similarly to that very well-known brand that started the whole anti-pore primer craze.
They fill in the blanks, so to speak, so that makeup goes on more smoothly.
It works well on my nose, and even worked decently on the one pore I nicknamed 'The Pit'.

Cute packaging that once again is similar to that popular brand.

These are more environmentally friendly option for facial care. They can be used for cleansing or makeup application.
Packaged nicely in an eco-friendly box, so would make a suitable gift. At first I wondered why they included the bag, but of course, no one wants loose sponges tumbling around your washing machine. Simply put them in the bag and when you're ready to do laundry, toss the whole kitten caboodle in the washer. I let them air dry.

These are SO much nicer than the ones in the store.
This company really has the size and softness of the towelettes correct.
A little bit larger, and they cleanse better, as opposed to simply coating your hands with an antibacterial solution.
No irritation or dryness.
The first second or so there is a slight stickiness, but when it dries, no stickiness whatsoever.

This review is for the Burgundy Short version of this product, and for reference, my glove size is 7 1/2, or women's large.
While it might not be the case for everyone, they included sizes that are a perfect fit. I did not use the smallest, nor the largest nail sizes.
The burgundy color is gorgeous.
The only filing needed is the very tip.

Set does NOT include the adhesive tabs, so remember to have enough on hand.

I like these clips because you have the option of threading a scarf or ribbons through them.
I have longer hair, but its very fine.
As you can see, even fine hair stays securely up.
Nice assortment of designs.
The hinges are on the tight side. They appear to be well made but time will tell.
The teeth do not bend. Some of the ends of the teeth on some of them have a bit of roughness, as if they need to be filed smooth. Not taking any points away for that, given the low price point.

I often use the Olay water activated cleansing cloths. The problem is you can only use them at home. They are not individually wrapped. You have to take one and put it in a ziplock.
These are these individually wrapped, and create the same amount of sudsiness.
They are pretty close to being without any scent, but I did detect a faint fragrance reminiscent of cornflower, which does not smell like corn, nor does it smell like a flower. Slightly citrus.
They contain willow bark extract, known for soothing inflammation.
No stickiness after rinsing. Skin feels clean without being dried out.
Definitely keeping one in my handbag for any freshening up emergency.

I love eyelashes. Actually, I love anything girly.
These would be terrific for someone that is experimenting with lashes for the first time.
The band is slightly thicker than most lashes, and you get quite a few for a low price.

Some of the included lashes had some damage. It looks like they were curled under too high of a heat, and they fizzled a bit.
They wouldn't be good enough for going out, but they would be perfect for practice putting on lashes. Application can be daunting for a beginner. Expect to ruin a few pair the first time you try false eyelashes. Use the damaged ones first just to get and idea of how to put them on, and toss them.

Disclosure: Product received at a discount in order to test and review. I have no affiliation with the manufacturer other than agreeing to test their item. All views and opinions are my own.

We have been using this nozzle for a few weeks, and there are no leaks.
That's amusing because we aren't always as careful as we should be when we are finished spraying.
It has hit the cement sidewalk more than a few times, without any damage at all.
The feature that allows it to stay on without pressing the lever is quite handy when we top off the pool or are doing a lot of spraying. It saves your hands from getting sore. Multiple settings for water sprays.
Nice quality, has a nice heavy feel in your hand.

Product received to test with the option to review. No financial compensation is EVER accepted, and vendor may request that item be returned. Views and opinions are my own.

I've had a couple of versions of this style of detangling brush.
Do they work? YES!
Do they last? NO!

Except for this one. It has outperformed the others.
First, a bit about these brushes. They come in a number of shapes and paddles, but are similar in that they have the same kind of plastic bristles.
The bristles stagger in length, and painlessly smooth knots and tangles.
Most of the time the bristles start to bend and then the brush is useless. After months of hard use, this one is still good as new.

These are a favorite with parents of kids with unruly hair, because they don't hurt.
I like it for myself, and it's also my 'secret weapon'.

I have 2 Maltese dogs, one is in full coat. That means long, flowing hair to the ground. Most people with a Malt in full coat need to section off the coat and roll up the hair, otherwise it gets so tangled it needs to be cut.
This hairbrush is a silky coated dog's best friend. Maltese, Yorkies, Afghans, Havanese...they need this brush!

When I was a little girl, I remember seeing a callus razor of my mothers, and wondered why anyone would use one. Now that I am past the age that she was at that time, I confess I found myself on the hunt for the perfect pedicure items for those of us prone to alligator feet! Forget the ped-egg, it stays sharp for about a minute. Real women use blades! Caution, go lightly the first time, and always on WELL SOAKED tootsies. Less is more, a bit of callus is supposed to on our feet. Turn the double edged blade around for the second foot, then toss it, never use more than once. Buying them like this is the cheapest way to go. These are great quality blades at a great price.

[[VIDEOID:5f071d40944ad845a102d811a0949121]] This is an absolutely amazing value in terms of quantity.
Lots of amazing colors that will delight teens and queens and the occasional club kid. Plenty of neutral pans of shadow for more conservative types, lots of great pop colors for the drama types.

You will need a good primer, like many shadows they disappear quickly without one. Some colors are also much different on the skin so don't be afraid to experiment. Sensitive eyes might want to do a swatch test.
Comes with double applicators, and a handy inside mirror.

As one that makes a lot of my own skin care preparations, argan oil is a key ingredient in many of them.
Mixed with rosehip seed oil and a little emu oil, it makes an excellent lotion for chapped and cracked hands and feet.
Adding some avocado oil makes it amazing as a pre-wash hair conditioner.
Apply to the hair while it is dry (and scalp if you have a dry scalp), then after anywhere from a minute to an hour, shampoo it out for soft, silky hair.

Used on it's own or as an ingredient in a DIY skin preparation, rosehip seed oil is a multi-use mini-miracle.

It can be used on the skin or hair, it even works wonders on dry, ragged cuticles.
Rough cracked heels and/or scaly feet? I took equal parts of this oil and emu oil, and rubbed it on my feet after dry buffing. Socks go on, and like me, you will wake up to soft, silky feet.

Any oil can go rancid, so keep it in the fridge.

Very pleased with the quality of this rosehip seed oil I was given to test.

These are perfect to use a few times when you do a hot conditioner on your hair. They are not the heavy kind that last, but perfect in certain situations. They are similar to hotel shower caps. Easy to pack if you are going to be someone's houseguest.

Great for deep conditioning your hair. Slather on the conditioner, put on the cap, and wrap a hot towel around your head.

I bought into some hype and bought a set of Gold masks. You know the ones...expensive face shaped masks that are somewhere between gummi bear and un-gelled Jello. And while using it, you look somewhere between King Tut and C-3PO, the Star Wars robot. Afterward you feel like a Ghostbuster that got slimed.

Forget all that and relax with nourishing botanicals. The ingredients soothe and help reduce splotchies and redness.
Spa quality facials at home.

This shampoo works fairly well. I am not certain why it is specifically for men. The shampoo lathers easily and leaves my hair soft. It also has a nice scent. The bottle is only 250 ml, whereas most shampoos are at least 400 ml so the price is relatively high for the size.
Look really pretty, easy to clip in and holds well.
Gave my face a nice clean feel without drying it out.
Nice smell, left my hair feeling clean. Perfect for little kids who have a hard time pouring out liquid.
The little girl loved the brush and the hair ties don't pull her hair out.
Left my skin feeling soft and not greasy.
The print is super cute, the stretch is good as I have medium to thick hair and I can wrap twice to do a good bun.
Color is pretty and the color split looks good.
No hair pull so far, and great stretch. Worked perfectly for my hair.
Did some deep face painting for Halloween and these worked well. Has a clean smell to them and didn't dry my face out.
Nice set for a first timer like myself.

Easily wiped off, if you want it to last longer using a makeup setting spray. One of the pallets came broken on the side and they were really oily. But they did stand out in color well, if using multiple colors be patient and let dry so you don't run colors.
Nice shade of brown and the hair has a natural thickness to it. Using for a cosplay and it matches. Value for the money.
Great smelling shampoo, used this morning and it still smells good. Doesn't sud up a lot but works good.
My husband is always using my face wash so I wanted to get him his own. He says it made his face feel clean but not dry. The smell was really good too.

Goes on smooth. Takes a while to soak in and is sticky before being fully absorbed. Excellent results by morning.

I like it.

A creative dispenser design provides excellent control. I like everything about it. No shine. It makes skin feel like the morning dew.

It's pricey and worth it. I will re-buy.

This 6-head Suttik replaces what seems like an identical motor version with 5-heads. This breed of shavers is the first I've ever used in the steamy hot AM shower every day. Day after day. What a time saver! It does a fantastic job. It delivers a better shave than my really high-$ screen shaver.

6 heads is an improvement over 5. First, it simply covers more area. This is your head ---> a spheroid with protuberances. The 6-head shaver conforms to stuff like your ears and jawline better. 6-heads get the cutter closer to the nooks and crannies where those obnoxious thickets of long hairs might survive for a couple of days before someone points and say, "Ewee!"

The shaver is small and easy to hold. A charge lasts more than a month. Cleaning is easy. I use shaving cream to lubricate, just like a regular razor. A 'dry' shave in the shower might sound like an oxymoron, but you'll know what I mean when you use it once.

I'm sold. Adds at least 5-minutes of goof-off time in my morning routine. I'll take every minute I can gather. Perseverance might payoff with a straight razor shave, but the time saved here to goof off in the AM pays off immediately!

It's revolutionary.

Was my review helpful? If so, click "Helpful" so I can know.

10-year-old super mega-brand vs. SOGUE:

1. The SOGUE operates 10K VBM (vibrations/minute) faster. That's why I choose the SOGUE.

2. Generic replacement brushes aren't interchangeable between the two. The SOGUE has a smaller shaft. The brushes are also smaller.

3. The SOGUE comes with like a year's supply of brushes, unlike the super mega-brand. They are just a tad softer than I prefer. It took me some years to technically discriminate my preferred bristle adjective (soft, medium, hard) for re-order. My brush changing rule is 'new brush for every recharge' as brushes are now so inexpensive. The charges on these toothbrushes have got to be the longest-lasting rechargeable device in the house. It seems like months go by on a charge.

4. The SOGUE and brush are about a quarter smaller. It's a noticeable difference. After a minute of thought, I think smaller is likely better as your teeth and the spaces in between are much smaller than you think. Maybe it's getting in tighter corners.

5. The SOGUE charges in like 2 hours vs. overnight for the super mega-brand.

I was looking at the super mega-brand's newest models at the big-box store. The price is absurd given all the competition from suppliers like SOGUE. The latest super mega-brand models appear the same size as the SOGUE. At a third of the price and assuming the charge life is long, it's a no-brainer. I'll adapt. Most of the difference between the two is a matter of personal preference.

SOGUE wins for now. Better than advertised.

Was my review helpful? If so, click "Helpful" so I can know.

The product delivers. It's a nice hyaluronic serum.

Value for money. Better than expected.

Really good. As good as hand cream gets.

Smooth, super moist (too moist if you handle legal docs too soon after application). Nice scent.

Much better than expected.

These are great for traveling, where you may not want to bring along bottles that may leak or cause a problem. These are easy to pop in a Ziploc and carry with you, and are lightweight and very easy to use.

I just tested these at home by wetting them in my sink, scrubbing them across my face to clean at the end of the day, and they did a great job getting off sunscreen and oils so that I could do my nighttime facial skincare routine. They did not cleanse overly much to where my skin felt tight or dry, and my skin felt cleansed but still retaining some of its natural moisture.

This has an exceptionally refreshing fragranced with essential oils. Reading the ingredients, I was impressed that the ingredients have detoxifying qualities. It really showed in the experience of how it was to use the salts.

Though the instructions said to use the entire bag, I was a little shocked by this because it's a lot of salt and also at the time of purchase, the product was listed at about $35, so it seemed way too luxurious to use the entire thing. However, I tend to agree with them that half the bag was not quite enough and when the bath was full, I couldn't really smell the fragrance anymore with just half the bag.

That said, even with just half the bag, I could feel the detoxifying qualities and after the bath I rinsed off well in the shower to remove any of the toxins that had come out through my skin.

The sharp, rough rose quartz gem that was included was a bit of a surprise. I would've expected that in a product that you're supposed to dump out into your bathtub, they would've chosen a smoother stone rather than a rough one. It had some serious sharp angles to it. I would definitely recommend fishing it out before dumping the bag in your bath so that you don't scratch your bathtub. It is beautiful, though.

Overall if the price to you seems fair for a single bath, then I highly recommend this product. The quality level is great, it's just a matter of how much do you want to spend for a single bath.

My five-year-old absolutely adores these big, beautiful bows for the hair. The alligator clips are easy for her to use even by herself, and not only does she likes to wear them, but she also loves to put them on her 18 inch American girl style dolls..

There is a beautiful array of child pleasing colors and patterns, and these were a big hit at our house.

This is kind of like a cross between a toner and a serum. I have been using it kind of like klairs moisturizing toner, even though it is a little thinner than that. It slaps on and seems to spread over my face nicely, sinks in very quickly, and provides a nice boost of moisture prior to putting on a thicker serum and then moisturizer.

I had been reading about this product for really long time before trying it and it's kind of a cult favorite in the K beauty world. I can see why. It's not flashy, but as a first thing to splash on your face and hold in some of that moisture, it works well and doesn't clash with other products.

I love the zingy, fragrant scent of the shampoo. It feels relatively unisex, and doesn't leave a lot of fragrance lingering behind after you rinse it out. I followed up with a peppermint conditioner from the natural food store, and really enjoyed the lovely cooling summer pick me up for my hair.

The shampoo is not overly stripping, but definitely leans more towards really getting things clean rather than being overly moisturizing. I found that I could use it about three times a week on my long hair, and then needed to do co-washing or something more moisturizing in between. I really like the shampoo and appreciate having something more herbal like this in my regimen.

My kids and I have been doing a lot of crafting which involves placing tiny sequins and gems on to small painted wooden or clay items, and so while we are not using these for the intended purpose of going on nails, we have been going through these quickly using tweezers to get them out and apply to our craft projects.

I've been really impressed with the variety of the sequins, the quality level of them with the thickness and color reflectivity being great, and the quantity given. We all really love these beautiful butterflies and how vivid and fun they are.

The color change works well. The colors themselves though are very translucent. The sparkles are large and sparse, but good quality that somehow doesn't feel rough.

It cured up well and had decent durability. Overall I'm happy with the quality. I do wish the bottles made the colors inside a little more obvious.

I shouldn't be surprised, since this brand has an incredibly good reputation for providing a high-end and effective experience, but I was indeed surprised by just how much I love these effective and cooling little gel eye masks. I have tried a number of gel eye masks in the past and found them reasonably pleasant, but this one actually left my skin around my eyes notably moisturized and looking younger for the rest of the day after use.

I just put these on in the morning right after my shower and did the rest of my facial and hair care routine, got dressed and by the time I was ready to greet my day, I took off the eye masks and moisturized, and the moisture that the eye masks held in actually seemed to take hold and reduce the fine lines that I usually have around my eyes from lack of sleep and having small children and a business to manage.

The fragrance is very light and unobtrusive, and the experience of using these is very luxurious. I have tried other eye masks that did not fit very well around my eye area, but these were shaped very nicely.

I wasn't sure what to expect from this, since most of the products from this line have had some level of fragrance are essential oil to them, but this is a very simple, unscented hand lotion, or rather a thick cream, which applies easily from the fliptop lid in small enough quantities that it is easy to control, and sinks into my skin almost immediately for a very fast effect.

As a landscaper, I have a few fingers that remain cracked and peeling for a good portion of the winter, and I've tried a number of different brands of hand cream to fix this. I was really impressed that after only a few days of use, my sides of my fingers of already healed. I didn't expect anything like that, and while I usually prefer to use hand lotions that are scented in some exciting fashion, I am partial to smelling of cupcakes or essential oils, I'm happy to have this simple work horse of a hand cream if it's going to do such a great job.

Desktop Pro 2019 upgraded smoothly and easily with absolutely no issues. I began by backing up my QuickBooks desktop Pro 2018, and then began the installation process. It went smoothly and quickly and didn't take very long. I used the express installation which was recommended, and the whole thing was very easily done, retaining all of my previous settings and information.

The part that was awful was that I have an existing payroll subscription and had to call into tech-support to upgrade that portion of things. Luckily I was aware of this so when simply entering the information into QuickBooks didn't work, I knew that I was in for a phone call. About 45 minutes later of being on hold and trying to be up sold on QuickBooks online by an Indian tech-support person (hey guys, I just got desktop Pro 2019 upgraded, please don't sell me on QuickBooks online), I was good to go.

I think it's absolutely offensive that after you've purchased a software product like this they make you call in as a matter of course to activate. Anybody using this product is either being paid by the hour or runs a business and does not have that kind of spare time to sit around wasting on a process that should be 30 seconds of data entry.

I have multiple employees and so end up paying an additional 4 to 8 dollars per month for the subscription to add additional employees. It's another two dollars a month per employee after the first one. Also, be aware that the setting is set to subscribe you to an annual payroll subscription, which if done through QuickBooks will cost you about $420. Purchasing the new upgrade of desktop Pro 2019 with the payroll for a year costs less than that, so being automatically billed such a high amount for just the payroll is offensive and ridiculous.

I would really like QuickBooks as a company to reconsider how they deal with their payroll subscriptions and activation of payroll that has already been purchased, because this is a huge problem that is been garnering them poor reviews and lots of bad press for some time. I personally have considered many times changing to a more congenial company just to avoid this particular dance every single year. Do I pay $420 to avoid being on the phone for 45 minutes with somebody from India who act like I've done something terribly wrong by purchasing my payroll upgrade on Amazon along with the software upgrade? Or do I do as I have done most years and purchase the yearly upgrade that comes with the enhanced payroll.

As an FYI, the enhanced payroll really does make it very easy to run your quarterly reports and do your e-filing. I did it myself for many years, but now hand the file back and forth to my bookkeeper via email as a portable file.

This set of fine misters is absolutely perfect for making room sprays, scented toners, and other things with my favorite essential oils. After giving birth, I made a witch hazel spray for healing, I made a tea tree toner to soothe skin during breakouts, and I made a room spray with lavender and eucalyptus to keep in the room with the diaper changers. It's great that this comes in a set of three and that the sprayers put out a fine mist rather than a thick set of droplets. I also really like the cobalt blue color. Though I received a sample for review, the positive opinion is my own.

I had previously been using Lush's Mask of Magnaminty and had really been enjoying it, however I think I was ready for a little bit more of a "grown-up" facial mask to help reduce the appearance of some of the fine lines I have developed in the year since having my son.

I have gotten to use this facemask twice and have been super impressed with the results. I am also using the retinol facial moisturizer as well as an ocean mineral toner and cleanser from this brand, and while I was seeing great results from the other products, this mask really supercharged the results. I look like I have had a full nights sleep, which I can assure you I have not! It plumped up some of my wrinkles and just gave my face that dewy fresh appearance that I remember having in my 20s.

I received samples of these products to test, but I can't argue with the results. I will certainly be purchasing more from this line.

I’ve tried other brands of argan oil, and have been surprised that some of the brands almost seem more like canola oil or a neutral oil, to where I almost wondered if some of them are counterfeit. Not so with this brand. This brand has the natural scent of the real deal, and is effective to boot. I have a baby, so have been washing my hands about 10 times a day, every time I change his diaper. Between that and all of the diaper wipes I use, my hands have been starting to peel and crack, so I knew I needed a solution.

This argan oil came with a regular lid, an eyedropper, and a pump dispenser. I used the pump dispenser and set it right next to my faucet so I could get a quick pump of oil every time I wash my hands. Well, it only took a couple of days to experience really great results. My hands feel normal again, and I am so relieved. From hard skin that was rough and crackled, to soft, happy hands again.

I have also used the product on my split ends, and here, I’d like to caution you that only a few drops are needed. It is very effective and soaks and well, so you only need a very small amount.

Overall, this argan oil is one of the best I have found. It comes packaged beautifully and looks like a gift, has multiple options for how you dispense it, and is pure, organic, and has the mild scent of real argan oil, unlike some competitors.
Beautifully packaged.  Easy to work with.  Amazing results!!  Will buy again!

Absolutely amazing deal AND It Came With Extra Goodies! This Yebo set was one of the “daily deals” and on sale for about $8.50, its UNBELIEVABLE for the price.
I got this thinking my 12 yr old daughter could use it to practice braiding and styling. It came with a head with attached 24” synthetic hair, clamp stand, combs, clips, ponytail holders, bun maker and more. The clamp stand alone is worth $6.
The head has a hole in the bottom to attach it to a tri-pod (Wig stand) if you have one but if you don’t that’s ok, just use the included clamp which easily attaches to any table.
The hair feels good and for the price it’s great for hats, glasses, barrettes, earrings, the possibilities are endless.
This is more than fine for beginners of ANY age. I could see younger kids loving this to play with too.

These Mountain Falls Advanced Formula Nail Polish Remover Pads work great, they're fast at taking off heavy polish and are perfect for traveling by plane.
Each single packet containd a thick moist pad that did all ten of my fingers in no time which I appreciate. These do have a smell but it's to be expected with any strong polish remover.
There are only 10 packets in the box so as far as price goes, these are costly for regular use but if you have a trip planned or you regularly travel these are perfect.

When looking for a wig I always find pictures to be far more helpful than words. Hopefully the pictures I've included can help someone make a decision. This wig is less than a week (Took a bit of work to get rid of the shine to the point where I felt comfortable). I used dry shampoo and played with the style alot back combing etc..I have been wearing high end LONG human hair wigs so it was a stretch to try this, but I NEED to cut down on the money Im spending and $130 is much better. It has been awhile since I've ordered a Raquel Welch 1. Because I find "Tru Life fibers do not last) especially when you add heat 2. Her wigs move around on me even with/without wig caps, wig bands, It Stays..etc..So I buy combs and clips and sew them in myself just like on a lace wig (its actually much easier on these)..
Im happy with this for the price, the fact that it was PRIME and here in 1-2 Days🎈yea!!.. and would order another BUT it does shed quite a bit which is bothering me considering its 3/4 days old.
I like where this wig falls on me (which will be different on everyone). The piece that keeps falling in my face is driving me crazy but I will keep "training" it. Pics are taken in in several different lightings. There is an RL 14/88 and SS 14/88.. This is the SS..Hope this helps someone..

I’ve gotten similar ones to these before that barely make it through one day, and slightly better ones that can be reused for two or three days. These are probably the best ones I’ve had so far, lasting 3 to 5 times, depending on how thick your hair is and how tight you make it. Nice multipack, especially if you’re on the go, and because they’re small, you can always have a few extra. Comes in 4 resealable bags of 250pcs for easy use and storage.

This patchouli beard wash is awesome, and I’m not gonna lie, it’s also pretty good for the downstairs beard, if you know what I mean. The fragrance is woody and just strong enough to notice from up close, but not so strong that it follows you around everywhere. Gentle on your skin, and leaves hair looking, smelling, and feeling it’s best.

There’s such a strong, sweet, artificial vanilla flavor and smell to this that is cloying and sickening. Yuck. I hate it.
Once it sets (about 2-5 minutes, which is longer than most), it looks matte and stays in place very well. It took 4 layers to look fully black on me.
Would be 4 stars if it didn’t taste and smell horrible. 3.5 stars

I love witch hazel for cleaning my skin and helping prevent breakouts. This works as expected, though the wipes are quite small, and as far as the packaging goes, the hole to take the wipes out is tiny, so it’s a bit of a pain to get your fingers in there. Otherwise good wipes!

The current price of $17 isn’t bad for something sturdy that can last far longer than plastic equivalents. It comes with 10 razor blades, which because they are double sided, can be reused more often, as well as being able to manually sharpen the blades if you really want to go all the way with sustainability. Speaking of which, this is a superior choice in those terms, as the blades do not have plastic components and involve minimal packaging when ordering refills. Good product—see pic!

This ornate crown in rose gold, tones of amber, and hints of ivory and bronze creates an elegant, striking look that will have the wearer feeling like royalty. The size and proportions make it a grand statement piece that matches with a variety of looks, particularly those with warm or earthy colors. Great quality, doesn’t tangle with hair much, and a bit of weight to make this an absolutely gorgeous accessory.

Wow, these are So much better than using your brush or those plastic scrapers. My tongue has never felt cleaner; furthermore, the next day, morning breath isn’t so bad! Your tongue is so clean from the night before, that your whole mouth just seems more fresh the next day. Absolutely wonderful! Highly recommend.

I’m happy to say that these looked the same as the product photos, and they are individually packaged so that you can give each one as a gift to six different people, or keep them all if you want. Nice amount of fluid, fairly easy application, though you might need to apply it twice to get the right opacity, and once it’s dry, it stays put without smudging.

At the current price of $15 for a set of four, you pay 3.75 per tube. The fragrance is light and vaguely like green tea, but not quite as herbal (too bad—I adore green tea), but it’s still good. As for the texture and moisture—a tiny bit greasy but very moisturizing, perfect for dry hands or feet. Korean skincare is terrific, and these make a great gift with cute little gift boxes.

This four pack of lip color features a fairly limited palette for those who like warm, deep reds. I wouldn’t say it’s the most matte lipstick I’ve ever seen; rather, it has more of an eggshell finish, but they look good for the price and are quite opaque.

This wig is absolutely gorgeous, with a great length and plenty of fullness for a sexy, luxurious look. You can’t tell in my pictures, but in bright light, you can see that hint of burgundy red, and in dark or light, it looks like a natural brown black. The only downside is that the part looks a little bit fake, but other than that, it’s a beautiful wig at a reasonable price.

The rich blue pigment looks stunning for your eyelashes, and it can also be applied to the eyebrows. My only criticism of this is that the new style applicator brushes don’t do as good a job as the longer bristled ones. I have no idea why so many companies have switched over to this design. Also, the liquid is thin enough to be a little messy sometimes. Once you get used to everything, the brilliant color looks great.

I’m not sure what happened, but this is a photo of everything that was included with my kit. It only included one set of 12 colors, and without the others, this actually isn’t very useful to me. I can’t give this more than two stars when it doesn’t have what it said it would. I hope they fixed this, which it appears they have from the other reviews. Shame. It was otherwise fine.

I was so excited about this, and with the price tag, I had high hopes. Unfortunately, it caused a pretty dramatic reaction, and my face began to itch and burn. I hate to say it, but for people with sensitive skin, sometimes a long list of natural ingredients isn’t really the best thing. Or at least it wasn’t for me. I feel very uncomfortable and I’m going to go wash my face now. Also, it smelled weirdly chocolatey, which is not something I expected at all, but it’s not a good smell in my opinion. (But if you like that, then you might appreciate this. If you have sensitive skin, this might not work out for you.

This creamy formulation is great for very dry skin, providing lots of moisture that stays locked inside. The ingredients are natural, cruelty free, and don’t irritate my sensitive skin, and it seems to be fragrance free as well. Nice way to pamper your skin

I was concerned that one of the bottles had some bubbling in the plastic, but it turns out it didn’t affect anything, so everything is ok (photo shows this). As for the spray, it produces a Very fine mist — perfect!

This is a great set of basics to cover most household needs right now. Happy with the scissors and everything else—DIY life! It’s amazing what you can do with a few simple tools and some tutorials as bd practice. It’s good enough for looking a bit tidier on Zoom!

These no-frills toothbrushes are pretty basic, but they get the job done. The eco-friendly recyclable packaging, plus the bamboo body for the toothbrush, make these a thoughtful choice for those avoiding heavy plastic use. The bamboo will discolor over time, but I haven’t had any health issues related to that. It can look a little mildewy—no big deal. Considering you get a little toothpaste with each box, the price per brush and paste set of $2.60 is pretty reasonable.

This was relatively easy to use and had OK results. Context: my hair is dark dark brown at the root, but I have fashion colors that have faded. The previous color was blue, but part of it faded into various shades of brown, so the underlying color is a little bit uneven. Having said that, because this cream is not very opaque, you can see a lot of the underlying color beneath, so if you are trying to cover anything, this isn’t going to do a great job.
The product pictures definitely don’t match the results regardless. Unless you have very light blonde hair, this is only going to provide grayish highlights. That is even taking into account the fact that I was quite generous with this cream. This is the first time I’ve tried a product like this, so I’m not sure how the other brands do, but this was just OK for me. I wouldn’t recommend using this for anything other than some colorful highlights on short hair, maybe not in a color that contrasts too much.
I just got married, and this went to some of the girls who helped out. I absolutely love these post-party favors. They’re useful, cute, and a fun way to say thanks.

I only recently discovered face mist, and it has been such a lovely little treat when I’m feeling stressed or tired. You get a splash of refreshing aromatherapy that lifts your spirits, and in some cases, can moisturize or invigorate your skin a bit. The spray had a hint of rose and sandalwood in the fragrance, coming together to create an earthy and lovely smell. Nice!

I absolutely loved the rose quartz roller! It feels very gentle on your face and your neck, and the cold of the stone is soothing and reduces inflammation. I looked up some videos on YouTube and there is some conflicting information as to which way to use the roller. For the neck, I understand the lymphatic ducts are towards the bottom part of the clavicle, so to me it would make sense that you would roll downward to get the drainage closer to the ducts. In any case, this is a great massaging, relaxing, and skin care tool that looks beautiful.

As for the little bottle of tumbled rose quartz chips? No idea. Decorative?

I love the scent of rose, and this face cream cleanser smells just like a freshly picked flower. Absolutely lovely for removing your make up in a way that is moisturizing and leaves behind a beautiful scent.

The very light smell of this is not that bad,  but there’s something kind of weird that lingers, like a weird chemical odor. I mean, everything is chemicals, but I mean it doesn’t smell like any particular oil or plant or herb or spice. It smells kind of plasticky? It absorbs nicely and offers a smooth finish, but I’m just not quite sure how I feel about the fragrance. It’s not bad, and it’s light, so I guess it’s fine. Not the best, not the worst.

Here’s a rundown of each of these great travel products:
*Lip balm: incredibly smooth finish, mentholated, neutral minty scent
*Scrub: wow! It smells amazing, herbal, and refreshing. The exfoliating stuff is great for preventing blemishes and keeping your skin smooth.
*Facial cleanser: where I loved the other products, I just like this. It absorbs nicely, but it just has a standard generic sent. It is, however, subtle scent, even if it is similar to many other types of lotions.
*Body wash plus shampoo: awesome, fresh scent with herbal notes. Very invigorating, smells amazing.

I absolutely loved the jade roller and the scraping tool! It feels very gentle on your face and your neck, and there are instructions inside the box on how to use the rose quartz roller, with video links and care instructions for the natural rose quartz (it says jade, but this is rose quartz).
I looked up some videos on YouTube and there is some conflicting information as to which way to use the roller. For the neck, I understand the lymphatic ducts are towards the bottom part of the clavicle, so to me it would make sense that you would roll downward to get the drainage closer to the ducts. In any case, this is a great massaging, relaxing, and skin care tool that looks beautiful.

I absolutely loved the jade roller and the scraping tool! It feels very gentle on your face and your neck, and there are instructions inside the box on how to use the rose quartz roller, with video links and care instructions for the natural rose quartz (it says jade, but this is rose quartz).
I looked up some videos on YouTube and there is some conflicting information as to which way to use the roller. For the neck, I understand the lymphatic ducts are towards the bottom part of the clavicle, so to me it would make sense that you would roll downward to get the drainage closer to the ducts. In any case, this is a great massaging, relaxing, and skin care tool that looks beautiful.
Not only will this trim nose hairs, but it does so without pulling, which really helps. Only needing one AA battery, this small and portable trimmer travels well and doesn’t take up much room.

The colors are pretty nicely saturated (not too transparent or thin) and the shimmery ones look very pretty and subtle--not glittery, just picking up some light. The similarity of color warmth and tone make these ideal for making gradients and smokey eyes, with darker tones near the eyelashes and along the crease, a saturated mid-tone along the crest of the eye and diffusing from the dark/shadow areas, with light highlights under the eyebrows and toward the nose. Nice results with pre-matched, complementary colors.

I love the natural ingredients, and the scent, happily, didn’t smell like vinegar. It was subtle and refreshing, perfect for between hair washes. And that’s just about all it’s good for. This is just a refresher spray. It does NOT help with frizz, not even a little.

After a shower and with wet hair, you apply this cream, and your curls form with a soft set (not hard and crunchy) that look defined and bouncy. It’s light, so you won’t add so much weight that curls turn to waves, and the scent is subtle and delicate.
Having said that, this is comparable to cheaper products I use like L’Oréal Curve It Curl Taming Cream, and that’s Much more cost effective (current price of $3.99 Prime).

I have loved the idea of having a pedicure tub, but they're so big and only good for one thing. I love that this not only has all the bells and whistles, it folds flat for storage. It has rollers for massaging, it keeps the water warm so you can keep your feet in as long as you need. There's a remote so you can change modes without bending down. This is like the Cadillac of at home foot spas.

My poor hands are so dry, between the hand washing, dishes doing and home cleaning we're getting dry and cracked over here. I try to keep up with it by using lotions and creams. This is a nice thick hydrating hand cream. It smells really good too, sorta fruity and floral. It doesn't make my hands greasy, it absorbs quickly.
