I'm always interested in trying new skincare innovations, products and brands. I'm new to this American brand MD Complete but found the Vitamin C serum nicely packaged and high quality.

I use different serums in the morning and at night. This Vitamin C is a little thicker than what I usually use and is feels a bit oily -- but going on it is absorbed quickly and doesn't leave the skin feeling greasy. I would use it at night though. It felt deeply hydrating and the Vitamin C helps brighten and even out skin tone.

I have sensitive skin but did not experience any irritation, sensitivity or redness using this product.

This lipid facial oil comes quite pricey at $70 but it also gives you a large portion of 60 ml or 2 oz. Most of my serums come in 1 oz bottles, so while $70 is high it is not outrageous.

The facial oil is made in the USA and contains Resveratrol which helps combat aging. Resveratrol comes from grapes and has strong antioxidants. This Essential Lipid Power Infusion also contains argan oil, rose hip oil, and a mix of extracts.

I found this Essential Lipid Power Infusion to stay on my skin for a relatively long time. It left my skin feeling a bit greasy but once absorbed it felt very soft and well hydrated. I agree with the other reviewers that recommend using this in the evening because of the time that it takes for the oil to be absorbed.

This is a very small tube but the sunblock works well and is small enough that I can bring it everywhere, even on long bike rides. I love the stick medium - the sunblock was easy to apply and to smooth on without getting your hands dirty. It can get to the tough angles around the eyes and the nose. The sunblock is thicker than usual but effective. It has a great smell and not greasy. One application lasts reasonably long even when I exercise. It is important to reapply sunblock especially to do so frequently on hot and sunny days.

I didn't have any redness or irritation or sensitivity when using the sunblock.

I love trying new skincare products and brands from overseas. I've found French skincare products to be particularly innovative and high quality even when they are not expensive. Caudalie is well known internationally and has a spa in New York City's Plaza Hotel. It's products are among those always listed in a search of "what skincare should I buy while in Paris" or "What items should I buy at at French pharmacy?"

This travel kit with the favorite products is a relatively inexpensive way to try a range of Caudalie skincare and their distinctive ingredients. The brand is known for their use of the grapeseeds from a vineyard and discovering the antioxidants help to combat aging and free radicals. This kit has some of their more expensive creams in small doses, so you can try the range of creams (Vinoperfect, Premier Cru, Vinosource and the famous Beauty Elixir and Instant Foaming Cleanser. It comes in a zippered tote perfect for traveling. I love this set and plan to get one for my mother. While we can't travel during this covid pandemic, we can look forward to traveling together in the future. It's a gift of skincare and a promise of future adventures.

I have found my skin has become more sensitive in my 40s and with all the additional washing and bathing because of Covid 19.  I'm new to this brand but found this Cica cream to work very well. It immediately cooled and soothed my irritated skin without any greasiness or oiliness. It was quickly absorbed into the skin.  It left my skin feeling much softer, less irritated, soothed. It is something I plan to keep on hand.

This cleanser comes in a simple, colorful, & attractive red-and-white package. It spreads well over the skin and has a light feel. A little of it really goes a long way.

It is easy to remove and makes one feel fresh and clean after application.

The one drawback is that instructions are not given in English (only in Korean) so one is left unsure whether it needs rinsing or wiping it up with tissue is enough. There needs to be an English translation on the box in order to reach the international market.

I use a pea-sized portion which I mix until it froths. I apply the foam to my face and let it stand briefly before rinsing it off.  It leaves my skin feeling deep cleansed but not squeaky dry.  I have not had any sensitivity or redness or irritation.  It works well with my regular toner and serum.

This cream hydrates but feels very light on the skin.  It has glycolic acid helps exfoliate without causing me any redness or sensitivity or irritation.  I like the texture and the light citrus scent.

My quartz roller worked well. I washed it carefully first and then used the larger roller for my forehead, cheeks and chin. The smaller roller worked well under my eyes.  I liked the feel of the rollers as they massaged my face.  They did make a slight squeaky sound but they held up well.  It is similar to a face massage but very easy to do while relaxing at home. At this price, it is a reasonble buy.

This AG Hair Natural Remedy Apple Cider Vinegar is relatively expensive at $20 for a small bottle, but it is made of natural ingredients like apple cider vinegar, organic argan oil and protein from quinoa.  The spray is supposed to refresh the scalp and the hair, to reduce irritation to the scalp and to help soften hair.  I have been trying different scalp treatments and was eager to see how this would work.  It is less of a scalp treatment and more of a hair refresher but it does add bounce and lift to my hair.

I love this lamp! This lamp has both UV & LED lights. There are three timer settings; 30, 60, & 90 seconds plus has a sensor that will automatically turn on the lamp when you insert your fingers/toes.
The plate on the bottom is removable if you use it for toes. I would absolutely order this again if I needed to!
It's OK as sometimes it doesn't turn on and you have to keep messing w it. The light always comes on, just not the motor.
I haven't tried the rhinestones bands yet. I love the designs on the fabric bands. The bands fit great nice quality and wasn't tight  I can't wait to wear the others.
Great jars for cosmetics such as body butters.
I absolutely love this spray bottle. I wanna throw all my cheap plastic spray bottles in the garbage.  It saturate your hair in just a few sprays. Love it!
Very cheap!!!! I went and purchased a automatic brush washer.
Loved it was exactly what I was looking for it is easily adjustable n soft bendy material her 1st bday was a success
Great quality. Not overly shiny and looks real. Easy to use. Love it

LOVE this scent even with my allergies I'm okay. I only use Clear gel. Watch sizes vs price of deodorants through Amazon this is not the only brand I have found you think you are getting good price vs store but they are smaller.
Not silk and it’s cheap material that tears
Perfect for parting, made parting my 4c hair easier and neater, also surprisingly sturdy.
This worked perfectly for my 4c hair and made wash day so much easier!
Silicone is nice and soft and definitely gets those hard to reach places

My son loves it,
Good quality hair looks gorgeous on my daughter. She just loves the easy to care of soft and silky curls.
Extremely flimsy, not easy to get through the hair and my daughter doesn’t have thick hair. Rather disappointing we have tried 3 times and they bend incorrectly and the hair comes out. Whaaaawhawhaa
Very tasty and fun too might I add. It is a little messy if mixed with body fluids and will stain hotel sheet lol so use wisely. I highly recommend!!

Nice earrings, great for price considering you get 3 pair. Only problem is gages are bigger than normal piercing earrings from like WalMart or Claires. They are nearly twice (2×) the size so I do not really recommend for young children. It tends to be uncomfortable. I actually removed from my cartilage (pierced 17yrs.) due to discomfort
Arrived on time and product was exactly as described! Very satisfied with purchase!
These brushes are perfect for design, even some for Joe application. Good price and good quality

This style is very youthful and the coloring just right for me.  The cap is very lightweight and easy to adjust.  The wig comes with a net to wear over your own hair.  I recommend wearing it so the wig has a base to grip on to.  I also bought the wig brush and comb recommended with the purchase.  I am very satisfied!  No more bad hair day worries!
These towels are awesome. They exfoliate and clean your body/skin like no other. Excellent quality and they last forever. You will never use a washcloth again

When I first got it I was shocked at how small the bottle was! Like mini sized. I felt ripped off. But then I got around to using it and I really like it. The color changing is cool. Pink when it's warm and orange when it's cool, red when cold.
Was a gift for my daughter. She loved them. She uses them everyday.

These are SUPER sharp.  I have used this kind of clippers for over a decade.  When I first opened these, I felt like they were so sharp that I could do some serious damage.  Either I'm used to them now, or they have dulled just a tiny bit, but they are wonderful.  TEN TIMES better than anything I have ever bought from a store.  I have really bad ingrown toenails in one of my big toes, but I have removed both of them with these.  What relief!!  Be sure to keep the little plastic tip-protector that comes with it.  It protects the tip of the blades when they are stuck in a drawer.  It also prevents you from getting poked with it accidentally.
Didn't realize it was only 2 inches wide. Need 3 inches. Gave too my granddaughter she loves them. Have to may attention and read everything before  i order.

A Staple! Smooth on the eyes and stays on throughout the day.

Returned! It would've been good except, the location of the Heat Setting is directly on the Grip of the Iron.  Thus, every time you touch the handle you end up CHANGING the SETTING!  And that can be disastrous if the Changed Setting is Too HOT!
I had a sample size of this, loved it so much I bought the big one. The formula must’ve changed cuz the big one was totally different and doesn’t work

I honestly  hate these, none of the sized fit right and they will not glue down with out an air pocket, they dont sit sight on the nails, the plastic is think. ut when they are tri.med or filed it flakes in layers so you will get lots of snags
Its a little light so be careful not to knock it over; maybe glue some weights on the underside? Other than that, its a great product and a great price to match that.
I would order again,  fast shipping and as described
I ABSOLUTLY LOVE THIS PRODUCT,  IT MADE A WONDERFUL GIFT TO AUNTS, COUSINS,NEIGHBORS AND FRIENDS.  I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR SOME MORE FOR HERE AT HOME.

Used this on two pairs of boots. Took some of the color off of a brand new pie of brandy-colored smooth leather. Managed to not add any shine to the smooth leather, which is good. Refreshed my old pair of work steel toes.
Awesome as always.
Love this product. Will continue to shave with this FOREVER!
Love this color!  Its beautiful on. Perfect mild mustard.

Feel it is a great dupe for the overpriced BOOM STICK. I have enjoyed using it. It adds the glow or frost if you will, but is not heavily frosty and does not have any glitter. It is perfect for older women's wrinkled eyes. I would definitely purchase this product again.
A bit tight and I have a smaller head than some lol

This stuff is excellent. The smell is absolutely amazing. This takes me back to my childhood and the honeysuckle in our back yard. While I wouldn't want to smell like this all day since it isn't very masculine, it is great to enjoy while I shave. The soap is slick and performs great. This is a top notch product.

I have about 10 razors. I have been in search of better and better shaves. My Feather AS-D2 is awesome and smooth but perhaps a bit too mild. I fine even the Merkur 34C a little too aggressive for my skin. The Merkur Futur is horrible for me and is a paperweight for anyone who prefers mild razors. The iKon B1 slant is a perfect balance. Not too aggressive, and with a light touch it gave me a very smooth shave. I normally do 3 passes and then touch up areas that need it. I had 5 days growth when I shaved with this razor head today. I was amazed when I finished my first pass. It looked like I had done two passes with my other razors. I normally do with the grain, cross-grain, and then lightly against the grain.
With the B1 I did a with-the-grain pass and one very light across-the-grain pass and it looked like I was done shaving. I did a touch-up in one or two spots and I called it good. An against the grain pass would have left me absolutely BBS but that usually gives me ingrown hairs. Oh, by the way, no nicks, weepers, or irritation at all. The head is shaped very weird with the slant design but I was able to shave under my nostrils with ease; much better than most, actually! I really am impressed with this head.
I can't wait to do another shave tomorrow.
My shave:
iKon B1 head
iKon OSS handle from my 101
Persona Lab Blue blade (2nd shave on the blade)
Stirling Soap Co. British Leather shaving soap
Stirling Soap Co. Coniferous Pre-Shave oil

This cream product is so thin and virtually weightless on the skin, and unlike many more organic oil based cream blushes, this blush is not tacky or oily to touch. I find the ideal way to apply this blush is by dipping your beauty blender into the pan. My personal favorite color is the lilac, as it's a nice cool-toned muted baby pink color. I hope amazon never stops carrying this product. I will repurchase this forever. FYI, my skin type is usually sensitive and this has never broken me out.

This product is not suitable as highlighter if one is very pale. Also, the finish is not natural but glittery/shimmery bordering chunky. The bronzer will cling to any areas of the skin where one has peach fuzz/tiny hairs thus making the application process a pain.

I wish I could give this more stars.  I wish that it helped me grow long, thick, lush eyelashes.  But that is not the case.  There is very, very, very little product in the tube -- and it is extremely difficult to apply using the brush provided, particularly given the caution that you need to avoid touching skin when applying the product.  This might work for someone, but it certainly did not work for me.

I don't know why Made in France barrette fixings are so superior to anything made in the United States -- they certainly look the same and mechanically, they function the same, but for some reason, the French barrettes are just a whole lot better.  They don't pull or catch my hair, they don't stretch out of shape, they don't break and bend.  I know this is a lot of $$ to spend on a barrette when you can get one for a fraction of this price at your corner drug store, but these France Luxe barrettes are worth it.  This coral colored scallop design is beautiful, and the barrette hold a lot of hair.  This is definitely for thick hair.  France Luxe also makes boule style barrettes for fine hair -- so if you don't have a thick mop, I would check out the other France Luxe designs.  These are expensive for what they are, but they're beautiful and long-lasting.  And they work, always important in a barrette.  I can put this barrette in my hair and it stays put all day.
It does help in lubricating the blades and getting a smoother shave.

After trying out a Philips (Norelco) 7120 to see if I could escape the wet razor trap I was ready for the next step; that model worked fine, except that by design the battery doesn't last that long and I could seldom get an acceptable shave around the neck. The 1050x solves both problems, I can shave in less time (must be the blades it uses) and it charges very quickly (one hour, with a quick charge for emergencies).

It comes with a travel "sarcophagus" (which I find a nice detail) which can also be used to charge the razor, and a charging stand; the hair deposit chambers for each blade do fill quickly, particularly with anything older than a day old stubble for me, and a sign comes up asking you to empty them - which is done quickly and easily enough.

The only negatives are that it's quite a bit noisier than the 7120, but then again that is quite quiet... I still cannot get the best shave over the area between my mouth and my chin... But then again we all different facial features... And it's pricey... I'm still kicking myself for not buying this when it came out as a special deal... But I needed it too much to wait for another one to show up.

Update 20/02/10

After a year and a half of good service my HQ7140 would not start even with the cord plugged in, unless I left it connected for a couple of hours...Obviously not an option when you're trying to get to work. I was about to order another one, already cursing for having to go back to blades even if only temporarily; but before that I took it to a specialized shop; they opened it and showed me it was wet on the inside and told me the "circuit" was fried. I explained that I had followed the manual to the letter, cleaning the shaving heads and the hair chamber with hot running water. They suggested taking the shaving unit off when I rinse it, use only warm (not hot) water, and *not* cleaning the hair chamber with water... They essentially sold me a brand new Philips HQ7120 as a replacement to use with my existing shaving unit for a reasonable price; it looks exactly the same except it has a "Low" red light.

The interesting bit is that I had gone to them about a month ago to buy a new shaving unit and they told me the HQ9 heads would work fine with these models, not just the HQ8; the HQ9 feel even better, so much so that I would definitely buy the 8xxx series which use the HQ9... It was only when the 7140 failed that I realized just how much I depend on it and how well it has worked out - my technique still needs to improve and shaving still seems to take too long but no going back to blades for me!

-----------------

As a wet shaving refugee I didn't know what to expect; I was just tired of getting cuts everyday, and paying an exhuberant tax to the wet shaver companies; I didn't want to buy a top of the line model in case things didn't work out.

This has been a very pleasant surprise, as I'm getting close shaves with less fuss and no irritation; I beginning to get the hang of this and even the neck area is doing well.

The battery's first run lasted for 4 days, but I may be taking a lot longer than normal while I learn. The battery light starts blinking when it's fuly charged, by the way.

I have the Philips branded verion of this and it still says Made in Holland...
I used some of this to make DIY Stevia Glycerite.  It worked.  This is a LOT of pure glycerin, glad I've got it;  hard to find in a store.
This is a fabulous drink of moisture and youth for my skin. I'm using about once a week.  I love how my skin looks and feels.

Just started using this, but I am very impressed. I had some issues on my scalp that I've bee trying to clear up for years, (yes Years!).  I dropped this castor oil on the spots at night with a q-tip.  The problem has completely gone away.  Thank YOU!

These work great, just like any 'thai deoderant crystal', same stuff. They are a little 'rough' at first,  a use or two makes them smooth. You get 3+ pieces to make the weight,  packed in a box. So all in all a good deal if this method works for you! Also, since you're getting a few pieces, you won't be caught short when it inevitably smacks the tile bathroom floor and shatters 😅

Got this kit on sale for under $20, which is an absolute steal! I guess TOBS discontinued the scent, so the supplier was clearing out inventory.

It's a cologne-type scent with a modern vibe. The shave cream performs like other TOBS shave creams, which is a good thing. Easy to build a lather, reasonably slick and protective. The cream is harder than other TOBS creams I've used, but that doesn't affect performance in the least.

The kit also comes with a badger brush and a cologne. The brush is actually pretty good! It's black badger hair, so the bristles are relatively stiff/scritchy, but I prefer that. Had the typical badger funk for the first few shaves, but now it's neutral. No lost bristles yet, so it seems like a quality brush/knot.

The cologne is also nice, a matching scent to the shave cream. I find that it lasts 2-3 hours on my skin. It's a good office/professional scent: pleasant, inoffensive. Probably not going to turn any heads.

No matter how you slice it, $20 for this kit is a great value!
